He also sells his items on credit to regular customers.
 
This is Jean's first loan with Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. HOPE and his group are confident he will repay the loan. He hopes to continue to grow his profits and wants to take larger loans from HOPE in the future.

loans.use: to pay for zippers, patterns, and other sewing items.

loans.name: Jairo Denys

texts.es:
Jairo, es un hombre de hogar, dedicado al alquiler de mesas y sillas, tambien es empleado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, el negocio lo aprendió de unos amigos, ya tiene 5 años de realizarlo, de ser empleado tiene 4 años.
El solicita un préstamo para las mejoras de un pick up, donde transporta las mesas y sillas, además comprara dos mesas de metal, este crédito le dará el recurso económico que por el momento no posee para poder invertir en el mantenimiento del vehículo, pago de mecánico y comprarse dos mesas más que aumentaran su alquiler, será un gran aporte para que el pueda generar más ingresos para el hogar.
Su aspiración con el préstamo es poder darle mantenimiento al vehículo, dejarlo en óptimas condiciones, poder encontrar a buen precio las sillas metálicas, mejorando el negocio, esto le dará más oportunidades de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Jairo rents out household items, such as tables and chairs.  He is also employed and lives with his wife and their two sons. He learned this business from some friends and has already been running it for 5 years.  He has been employed for 4 years.

He is seeking a loan to improve his pickup truck, which he uses to transport the tables and chairs.  Also, he will buy two metal chairs.  This loan will give him the economic resources that, for the moment, he does not have.  He needs to invest in the maintenance of his vehicle, to pay a mechanic, and to buy two more tables to increase his inventory.  The loan will be a big help so that he can earn more income to pay his household expenses.

His goal with the loan is to be able to perform maintenance on his vehicle, to get his vehicle into optimal shape, to be able to find a good price for the metal chairs, to improve his business, and all of these things together will give him an opportunity to grow.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle that he uses to transport chairs, and the purchase of two metal chairs.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru: Марифат продолжает ремесло таджикских женщин, т.е. шить национальные платья. Ей 34 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Марифат решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условия проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Marifat continues the craft of Tajik women, that is, she sews national dresses. She is 34 years old. She is married and raising two children. Her husband receives a small pay. This pay is not enough to provide the family with all necessary means. 

Marifat decided to help her husband for the good of the family. With this aim she attended the course "Bring it on", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. She would like to set up a business of sewing women's clothing, as she has experience in this area of business. From the income received, she plans to improve the family's living conditions. 

Marifat requests a loan in the amount of 1,000 somoni for the purchase of a sewing machine, in order to set up her new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for setting up a new business

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru:
Махмуд житель района Рудаки. Ему 23 года. Он женат. Махмуд имеет среднее образование. Он предоставляет услугу. Махмуд два года как открыл дилерский центр. Он пополняет счета мобильных телефонов и продает сим-карты. 
Махмуд просит кредит для приобретения компьютера и покупки рекламных баннеров.
texts.en:
Mahmud is 23 years old. He is married and lives in the Rudaki region. He has a secondary education and works in the service industry. 

Two years ago Mahmud opened his own kiosk where he sells cell phones and SIM cards. Mahmud is requesting this credit for purchasing computers and advertising banners.

loans.use: to purchase computers and advertising banners.

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es:
Guisela es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Guisela no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta bailar y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, por la mañanas Guisela trabaja en una pequeña bodega brindando atención al público, adicionalmente por las tardes trabaja como cajera en un centro comercial de su ciudad, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le  va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Guisela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el pintado de su habitación y la compra de una computadora, la cual  le servirá de mucho, ya que pronto iniciará sus estudios sus estudios de computación, así ella se seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una buena profesional y conseguir un mejor trabajo, para así poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Guisela is a 21 year old single woman. She lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly person, a hardworker and enthusiastic who has a great desire to get ahead. Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and because of the need to work, Guisela has not been able to study for a professional degree. However, she would like very much to be able to do it. In her free time she likes to dance and occasionally cook a rich Ceviche to share with her family.

By her own initiative, with lots of work and dedication, Gisela works in the mornings in a little store getting the attention of the public. In addition, in the afternoons she works as a cashier in the commercial center of the city. She can work approximately 12 hours each day and she believes that she does well because of her good performance and the kind treatment that she gives to her customers.

Gisela is very grateful for the Kiva loans, now that thanks to the help they bring her she will be able to complete the painting of her room and the purchase of a computer, which will serve her very well, now that she can soon begin her computer studies. This way, she will continue working and making an effort to achieve her greatest dream of being a good professional and finding a better job so that she will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Yudy

texts.es:
Yudi es una joven e 29 años, es muy alegre y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, vive al lado de su esposo, quien es su mano derecha y sobre todo es quien le da ánimos para poder seguir adelante a pesar de los problemas que se puedan presentar, la vivienda de Yudi se encuentra en la ciudad de Camaná; , ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la pesa y la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, asimismo su gastronomía es diversa y uno de sus platillos típicos es el riquísimo “Rocoto relleno”. Yudi es muy trabajadora, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho mirar películas al lado de su esposo y en ocasiones le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Chupe de Camarones”.

Día a día Yudi trabaja en su pequeño negocio de confecciones y composturas de ropa, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente y Yudi cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque es muy responsable y cumplida con ellos.

Yudi está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya  que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una nueva máquina de coser, ya que la que tiene actualmente está muy viejita; así de esta manera ella podrá tener las herramientas necesarias para poder trabajar y poder luchar para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Comprar un lote para vivienda”.
texts.en:
Yudi is a young 29 years old, she is very happy, and she always strives to get ahead.  She lives with her husband who is her right-hand man and the person that gives her the strength she needs to be able to continue getting ahead despite of the problems she has faced.  Yudi's home is located in the city of Camaná.  It is a city known for its warm and friendly climate.  It is an agricultural center where rice is cultivated and it has diverse gastronomy.  One of its typical dishes is the delicious "rocoto relleno."  Yudi is hard-working, but when she has free time she likes to watch movies with her husband and enjoy her favorite dish, the delicious "Chupe de Camarones."

Each day Yudi works at her small business sewing and making clothing.  She works about 10 hours per day and can provide her services to 15 customers daily.  Yudi believes that her business is going well because she is very friendly, very responsible and earned their trust.

Yudi is very thankful for the Kiva loan and sends her thanks for the help that she is receiving.  She will be able to buy a new sewing machin because the one that she uses now is very old. Therefore, she will have the necessary supplies to be able to work hard to accomplish her biggest dream:  "To buy a plot of land so that she can build her own home."

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru: Надежда использовала предыдущий кредит для закупки дополнительной продукции и увеличения торгового оборота. На полученную прибыль Надежда сделала косметический ремонт в сьемной квартире и сьездила к родственникам в Россию. В этот раз Надежда просит предоставить ей кредит на покупку косметики и колготок к осеннему сезону.
texts.en:
Nadezhda used her previous loan to purchase additional goods and increase her inventory turnover. With her profits, she renovated her apartment and went to visit her relatives in Russia.  

Nadezhda is now requesting a new loan to buy cosmetics and tights before the fall season.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and tights before the fall season.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 61 years old and has three children. He is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Fernando requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets to raise and feed. He has been raising pigs for five years now, and has previously borrowed from NWTF 13 times to sustain his business.

In the future, Fernando would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена просит предоставить кредит, чтобы купить новые постельные наборы к осени и подарочные наборы к празднованию дня учителя, которые хорошо покупают родители учеников на подарок учителям. 

Елена ездила за товаром на оптовый рынок вместе с мужем город Одессу. В сентябре Елена ездила с мужем в Крым на море на неделю отдохнуть. Ночевали в спальных мешках на горе Ай-Петри. Благодарит за помощь в виде кредитов, которые помогают ей развивать бизнес.
texts.en:
Elena is requesting a loan to purchase new bedding before the fall, as well as gift sets for teachers' celebration day, as gift sets for teachers are popular with parents of students. 

Elena and her husband are back from a trip to Odessa where they bought merchandise at the wholesale market.  In September, they also took a week off by the sea in Crimea and camped on the Ai-Petri peak.

Elena is grateful for the help received in the form of loans, as they are helping her to develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase bedding.

loans.name: Zoila Teresita

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es jubilado y ella es Lic. En Ciencias De La Salud Natural.

Doña Zoila para salir adelante y con su actividad ayudar con los gastos de hogar se dedica a la venta de productos naturales,  ella  realiza trabajos de terapias a personas que requieren de sus servicios y allí mismo les vende los productos que según ella son muy buenos y de gran ayuda para la salud, razón por lo cual cuenta con muy buena clientela que mes a mes le piden que les realice sus terapias y que les venda sus productos. Trabaja todos los días, tienen más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos naturales que ella vende y utiliza en sus terapias. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal es la fiscal de reglamentos del grupo y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido. 

Su meta es seguir adelante ofreciendo sus servicios ya que le encanta lo que hace.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Desarrollo Femenino community bank meet in Calderón parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its delicious cuisine and its vegetation.  Most of the local people work in farming and general commerce.

This is where Zoila lives.  Zoila is 66 years old, married, and has six children from her marriage who are all adults.  One of them still lives with her.  Her husband is retired and Zoila has a degree in Natural Health Sciences.

Zoila sells natural products in order to provide for herself and help with the household expenses.  She carries out therapeutic procedures for people who need her services.  She also sells products which she claims are very good for people's health.  For this reason, she has a very good customer base who ask her to carry out her therapeutic services every month and sell them her products.  She works every day.  Zoila has been in this business for more than six years and she is doing very well.

Zoila will use this loan to buy natural products that she sells and uses in her therapies.  She has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she is the rule enforcer.  She likes being a member because it is a very united group.

Zoila's goal is to continue offering her services as she loves what she does.

loans.use: to buy natural products

loans.name: Dennis

texts.es: El Señor Dennis tiene 19 años de edad vive en la zona Los Jazmines en el municipio de Chimoré del departamento de Cochabamba es Técnico Eléctrico aprendió este oficio de su hermano quien fue como un padre para él ahora es independiente y tiene muchas ganas de superarse. Dennis es una persona sencilla y amable, desinteresada siempre estuvo acostumbrado a la labor del campo, soltero con posibilidades de irse para otra región pero el prefiere estar en el trópico ya que se acostumbró al clima, Dennis sufrió mucho ya que a temprana edad se separo de su familia y apenas con 12 años empezó a trabajar de ayudante de los que colocan postes de electricidad y paso por muchos momentos de pena y angustia ya que abusaban de su trabajo y de su inocencia paso el tiempo y aprendió a la fuerza los gajes de su oficio, él ahora tiene un comportamiento mas justo y enseña a los jóvenes como el de una forma mas motivante para que no tengan que sufrir como el sufrió, solicita una crédito para poder comprar una motocicleta para mejorar su servicio como electricista y trasladarse a los lugares donde lo requieren ya que paga mas al transporte que lo lleva a su destino, Dennis sueña con ahorrar construirse unos pequeños cuartos en su lote y además conformar una familia que pueda sostener.
texts.en:
Sr. Dennis is 19 years old and lives in the District of Los Jazmines in the town of Chimoré, Department of Cochabamba. He is an electrician who learned the trade from his brother, who learned it from their father. Dennis is now independent and has the drive to succeed. He is a modest, friendly, and selfless individual who was always used to working on a farm. Since he is single, Dennis has opportunities to travel to other regions but he prefers to remain in the tropics since he is accustomed to the climate.

Dennis endured much at an early age when his family was separated. When he was barely 12 years old, he began working as an assistant, setting up electrical poles. He experienced many moments of pain and anguish since he was abused at work and taken advantage of because of his innocence. Over time, he became stronger and knowledgeable in all parts of his job. Dennis now has a sense of fairness and teaches young people how to motivate themselves so that they do not have to suffer in the same manner that he had.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy a motorcycle so that he can improve his service as an electrician. This will allow him to travel without having to pay more for transportation services in order to get to his destination. Dennis dreams of using his savings to build a few rooms on his property. He would also like to start a family that he can sustain.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle so that he can travel to his jobs as an electrician.

loans.name: Freciosa

texts.en:
Freciosa is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Freciosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory to sell.

Freciosa has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years. She also earns an income from a motorcycle transportation business and from selling firewood and charcoal. Freciosa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is involved in agriculture. He keeps hens and colonies of bees and grows fruit trees. Andranik would like to start breeding cows, too, but the current income he gets is not enough to implement this goal. 

Andranik is requesting this loan to purchase two cows and an ox. Andranik also plans to purchase forage for them. Such expansion of the farm will allow Andranik to earn more income for the sales of milk and cheese and improve his family's living conditions. Andranik lives with his wife, son and daughter.

loans.use: to pay for two cows, an ox and forage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulls and calves.

loans.name: Helena

texts.es:
Helena, una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en el municipio de Soledad con su esposo y cuatro hijos. Ella pidió su último préstamo de Kiva para comprar lavadoras para alquiler a vecinos en el barrio, y frutas para vender desde una carreta. Sus negocios siguen creciendo y ganando ingresos para la familia. Ella también uso una porción de su préstamo para seguir construyendo una vivienda, porque quiere tener un lugar seguro para su familia. 
Ahora, Helena pide un nuevo credikiva para comprar mas frutas al por mayor, para poder obtenerles para un mejor precio y aumentar sus ingresos. También quiere comprar más materiales para la construcción de su vivienda. Ella tiene sueños de mejorar la condición habitacional de su núcleo familiar, porque quiere proveer una buena vivienda para sus cuatro hijos y su esposo. Ella quiere decir a sus fondeadores lo siguiente: “Con su apoyo he logrado mejorar en parte mi vivienda, y mi negocio sigue en crecimiento.”
texts.en:
Helena, a very hardworking woman, lives in the town of Soledad with her husband and four children. She requested her last Kiva loan to buy washing machines to rent to neighbours in the neighbourhood and fruit to sell from a cart. Her business continues to grow and earn income for her family. She also used a portion of the loan to continue building her house because she wants to have a safe place for her family.

Now, Helena is asking for a new loan from Kiva to purchase more fruit in bulk, to be able to get them at a better price and increase her revenue. She also wants to buy more materials for the construction of her house. She has dreams of improving the living conditions of her family because she wants to provide better housing for her four children and husband. She wants to tell her lenders that, “with your support, I have managed to improve a part of my house and my business continues to grow.”

loans.use: to buy more fruit in bulk and to buy materials to build her house.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a conservative young lady, she asked her brother to take her place in the photo.
Reem is a 19-year-old single lady who has applied for a loan so she can pay for her brother’s educational fees. He is majoring in accounting at the university. Their father works as a plumber to be able to support the family, but since they have a big family, Reem decided to take this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her brother’s educational fees.

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en:
Seryozha lives in Malishka village in the Vayots Dzor region with his parents, wife and 2 little sons. Seryozha runs a farm, where he has 3 cows and 11 hens and grows fruit trees. The main source of income is the sales of milk and cheese at the local markets. 

Seryozha would like to increase the number of livestock in his farm, for which he needs sufficient investments. With the help of this loan Seryozha will purchase a cow and 2 oxes. This will allow him to gather more income from agriculture, which is vital for him, the main breadwinner, to sustain the family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and 2 oxes

loans.name: Jorge Fernando

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre agricultor de 31 años de edad, soltero quien actualmente vive con sus padres  y hermanos en Sololá. Trabaja en la agricultura desde que  tenia 12 años cuenta que termino sus estudios académicos primarios y por razones económicas no pudo seguir estudiando y ahora conjuntamente con sus hermanos apoyan a la economía de su familia. 
El se dedica a cultivar cebolla, papa, frijol, remolacha y más a pocos kilómetros de su residencia, para luego cosecharlos y comercializarlos en el mismo lugar y en el exterior del departamento.
 Se a dado cuenta que en los últimos meses las cosechas son muy buenas y a las vez le han dejado buenas ganancias, de esta manera el solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para que el pueda comprar mas semillas de cebolla y papa así como otros insumos que se utiliza.
Unos de sus más grandes sueños es que en el futuro pueda lograr construir su propia casa o a lo mejor comprar terreno donde pueda cultivar más verduras.
texts.en:
Jorge is a farmer who is 31 years old, single and who today lives with his parents and siblings in Sololá. He has worked in agriculture since he was 12 years old, the age at which he ended his primary education and for economic reasons could not continue studying. Now, with his siblings, he supports his family's economy.

He works cultivating potato, beans, beets and more, a few kilometers from his home to later harvest them and sell them in the same place and in the edges of the region.

He has realized that in the last few months the harvests have been very good and he has seen them leave him with good earnings. In light of this, he sought a loan of 5,000 quetzals to be able to buy more onion seeds and potatoes along with the inputs that he uses. 

One of his biggest dreams is to be able to construct his own home in the future, or even better, to buy land where he can cultivate more vegetables.

loans.use: to buy potato and onion seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Manuel le esta haciendo falta la reparación e instalación de las tuberías del agua, gas y drenaje de su vivienda, solicita el crédito para solucionar el problema que se le esta presentando con estos servicios ya que son indispensable para su familia.
 El señor Manuel  y su esposa son  originario de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, tiene dos hijos adolecentes que estudian la preparatoria, el señor Manuel es empleado de una compañía de seguridad privada y su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa afuera de su domicilio y así estar al pendiente de la familia.
Con el sueldo que recibe el señor Manuel será para pagar el crédito y que su esposa le ayudara con las ganancias del negocio con los gastos familiares y escolares.
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida y el patrimonio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The home of Sr. Manuel needs to have pipes repaired and installed for water, gas, and sewage. He is requesting a loan to resolve this problem since these services are indispensible for his family.

Sr. Manuel and his wife are originally from the city of Nuevo Laredo. They have two teenage children who are attending a preparatory school. Sr. Manuel is employed by a private security company and his wife sells clothing outside of their home so that she can also keep an eye on their family.

With the salary he earns, Sr. Manuel will be able to repay the loan. The earnings from his wife’s business will help with family and school expenses. He wants to improve his children’s quality of life and leave them a better inheritance.

loans.use: to repair and install utility pipes in his home.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo, son personas humildes, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, trabaja todos los días realizando la venta desde las 10:00am a 7:00pm, tiene mas de 10 años de experiencia, de este negocio ayuda a su esposo a cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las totillas, como el maíz, leña, cal, que espera encontrarlo en mejor precio a través del dinero del préstamo, este será una gran ayuda para que Maria pueda abastecer de maíz su inventario y continue vendiendo a los clientes.
Su aspiración es salir adelante con el negocio, con el aporte del préstamo y que cuente con estabilidad para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su esposo.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband, they are humble people. She sells tortillas, works every day selling from 10:00 am to 07:00 p.m. She has an experience of over ten years. With this business, she helps her husband to cover home's needs.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials for preparing tortillas, such as corn, firewood, lime, which she hopes to find it at the best price through the loan's money. The loan will be of great help for María to supply her inventory with corn and to continue selling to the customers. 

Her aspiration is to get ahead with the business with the contribution from the loan and to have stability in order to cover her needs and the needs of her husband.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Hortalizas De Pacorral Group

texts.es:
La señora Antolina esta casada, tiene 47 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 11 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la comercialización de ropa de toda clase, inicio este negocio con el fin de tener una fuente de ingresos, y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara, para la compra de mercadería y tener un negocio surtido, y mas posibilidad de vender, en el futuro espera contar con un tienda de consumo diario, ya que quiere mejorar su ingresos. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Antolina is married, she is 47 years old and she did not have the opportunity to attend school. She has 11 children, out of which 3 are studying.

She sells all kinds of clothes. She started this business with the intention of having a source of income, and so far, she has an experience of 20 years. She is supported by her husband, who works in agriculture.

She organizes a group to request a loan that she will use to buy merchandise and to have a stocked business, and more possibilities of selling. In the future, she hopes to have an everyday-products store, because she wants to improve her income. The rest of the members of the group sell and raise animals.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: María Orfilia

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, reside en el sector de Chamelecón,  Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Desde hace 5 años inicio su negocio de venta de productos lácteos (queso y mantequilla) y chorizo parrillero. Doña María trabajo en su juventud en fábricas de textiles, actualmente  debido a su edad ya no le es posible encontrar empleo permanente.
Con el fin de obtener capital de trabajo ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por la cantidad de 3,500 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de queso, mantequilla y chorizo.
Sus planes a futuro es hacer mejoras a su vivienda y continuar apoyando a su hijo menor con el estudio.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 53 years old and a single mother with three children. She resides in the District of Chamelecón in the town of San Pedro Sula, Department of Cortés.

Five years ago, she started her own business of selling dairy products (cheese and butter) and grilled chorizo sausage. Doña María worked at a textile mill in her youth, but now it is impossible for her to get a permanent job because of her age.

In order to obtain operating capital, she decided to request a loan in the amount of 3,500 HNL. The money will be invested in the purchase of cheese, butter, and chorizo sausage. Her plans for the future are to make improvements to her home and to continue supporting her youngest child who is in school.

loans.use: to buy cheese, butter, and chorizo sausage.

loans.name: Jessilda

texts.en:
Jessilda is 57 years old and married with four children. She earns a living buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Jessilda is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Jessilda has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Josephine has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from seaweed culture.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lotche

texts.en:
Lotche is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Lotche has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from raising livestock.

Lotche has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora  Norma tiene 35 años, es casada, vive en una aldea rural del  Municipio de Arizona. En compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos.
Desde hace 10 años que Doña Norma se dedica al negocio de venta de lubricantes, repuestos para vehículo, baterías, filtros y herramienta. 
El padre de Doña Norma tiene un taller de reparación y mantenimiento de vehículos, lo que ella aprovecha vendiendo sus productos a los clientes del taller y al público en general.
En la actualidad ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 21,000 Lempiras, los cuales invertirá en la compra de mas repuestos, lubricantes y herramientas para reparación de vehículos. 
Ella espera que al surtir su negocio aumenten sus ventas y sus ingresos, los cuales piensa utilizar para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Norma is 35 years old. She is married, and lives with her husband and her two children in a rural village in Arizona municipality.  For 10 years Norma has worked in her business selling lubricants, vehicle parts, batteries, filters, and tools. 

Norma's father has a vehicle repair and maintenance workshop, which she takes advantage of by selling her products to the shop's customers and to the general public. 

Currently she has applied for a loan in the amount of 21,000 lempiras, which she will use to buy more parts, lubricants, and tools for repairing vehicles.    She hopes that by stocking her business she will increase her sales and her income, which she intends to use for improving her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy lubricants, filters, tools, and vehicle parts.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is 34 years old and married with one child who is in school. Ma. Lorena works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Lorena runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store.

Ma. Lorena has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream,  sugar, spices, shampoo, etc.

In the future Ma. Lorena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old, a widow and a mother of four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a fish pond business in the Philippines. Erlinda has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy small fish and fishing equipment.

Erlinda has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy small fish and fishing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy plastic goods such as bowls, basins, ropes, trash cans and chairs.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Don Pedro tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos que están entre las edades de 18 a 10 años. Es una persona muy trabajadora, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura a sembrar maíz, hortalizas y plátano. Este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, desde muy pequeñito. Los productos e insumos los compra en la ciudad, en donde los adquiere a un mejor precio, se tarda cuarenta minutos en trasladarse en su carro, hay ocasiones que aprovecha cuando lleva a vender los plátanos al mercado y en el mismo viaje compra los insumos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes y abono para 10,500 metros cuadrados de cultivo de plátano. Que ha podido cultivar gracias a los créditos que la Fundación le ha proporcionado. Con la inversión, podrá obtener una buena cosecha, permitiéndole que se desarrolle y crezca su cultivo; para que los ingresos económicos sean mejores para su familia. Su deseo, es trabajar con más cantidad de ganado, mejorar el corral donde lo tiene y ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Pedro is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and his four children ranging from age 10 to 18. He's a very hardworking person who has been working in agriculture for 20 years, growing corn, vegetables and plantains. He has learned this line of work from his father ever since he was very young. He buys the products and supplies in the city, where he acquires them at better prices. It takes him 40 minutes to get there on his car, and sometimes he makes use of this by taking his plantains to be sold at the market and purchasing the supplies on the same trip.
The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase fertilizer and compost for a plantain crop of 10,500 square meters, which he has been able to sow thanks to the loans that Fundación has provided him with. With this investment he'll be able to obtain a good harvest, which will allow him to develop and expand his crop, so as to increase his family's income. His wish is to work with a larger quantity of cattle, improve the yard where he keeps the cattle and help his children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and compost for a plantain crop of 10,500 square meters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay a debt to a money-lender who loaned him money to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Angela Patricia

texts.es:
Angela tiene un puesto de comidas rápidas desde hace unos años con el cual genera los ingresos para contribuir económicamente en su hogar junto con su esposo donde conviven con su hija de 15 años de edad. Como no cuenta con mucho capital en el negocio, Angela saca el mismo carrito de comidas rápidas desde hace muchos años, y esto entonces hace que su carrito ya se encuentre en muy malas condiciones. El problema es que Angela debe gastar dinero constantemente para hacer las reparaciones que requiere su carrito, y es por esto que ahora buscando mejorar esta situación, Angela busca un préstamo para comprar un nuevo carrito de comidas rápidas y poder tener mejores condiciones de trabajo.

Su sueño es poder tener un buen negocio que le permita tener mejores condiciones económicas en el hogar y también sueña con poderle ofrecer a su hija una educación de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Angela has managed a fast food stand for a few years in order to generate income and contribute financially to her household. She lives with her husband and their 15-year-old daughter. Since she does not have much capital in her business, Angela has used the same fast food cart for many years. As a result of wear and tear, her cart is now in very bad condition. Angela’s problem is that she is constantly spending money to have the cart repaired, which is why she is now looking for a better solution to improve this situation.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a new fast food cart and have better working conditions. Her dream is to have a successful business that will help to improve her financial situation at home. She also dreams of providing a high-quality education for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a new food cart.

loans.name: Institut Mbonga Group

texts.fr: Le client Hanyurwa est enseignant dans un institut secondaire Mboga. Ce client bénéficie régulièrement le prêt de l'IMF Hekima pour renforcer ses affaires, qu'il adjoint a son salaire. Grace aux  deux crédits, il vient de recevoir auprès de ce programme de microfinance, il a réalisé de petits investissements (achat parcelle) et scolariser ses frères. Le client est marié et père d'un enfant. Son épouse s'occupe de petits commerce. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d'ouvrir un magasin général dans son quartier. Le client salut grandement l'initiative de Hekima et ses partenaires de songer aux petits salariés tels que les enseignants et autres.
texts.en:
The client Hanyurwa is a teacher at the Mboga secondary school. 

He receives regular loans from Hekima which he adds to his salary to improve his financial situation. Because of two loans he recently received from this microfinance program, he made a small investment (bought a piece of land) and sent his brothers to school. 

Hanyurwa is married and a father of one child. His wife works in small-scale commerce. 

This new loan is to be used to open a general store in his area. 

Hanyurwa highly commends the initiative of Hekima and their partners to think of the working poor, such as teachers and others.

loans.use: to buy various goods (oil, soap, sugar, Fanta, clothing, beauty lotion, etc.).

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es:
María, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada, vive en una Colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos. 
Hace un año que María decidió establecer un negocio de venta de productos alimenticios de consumo diario como ser granos básicos, pastillas, salsinas, productos enlatados, carnes, refrescos, embutidos y otros. Con este negocio ella aporta al hogar para la manutención de sus hijos. Ella ya tiene su clientela y los atiende todo el día. El préstamo que solicito es por 15,000 Lempiras y es para comprar una refrigeradora para vender carnes, y con una parte va cubrir gastos de remodelación del local para que quede más amplio su negocio y surtir más ya que su demanda se ha incrementado. Su meta es que el negocio crezca y poder ayudar a sus hijos que culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old. She is married, and lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula with her husband and her three children. A year ago, Maria decided to establish a business selling food products for daily use, such as staple grains, pills, tomato sauce, canned products, meats, soft drinks, cold cuts and other items. 

With this business she contributes to the household expenses and to the costs of supporting their children. She already has her clientele, and serves them all day. 

The loan she has applied for is for 15,000 lempiras, and it is to buy a refrigerator for selling meats. With one part of it, she is going to cover the cost of renovating her shop, so that her business will be larger and better supplied, as her demand has increased. 

Her goal is for her business to grow, and to be able to help her children complete their education.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for selling meats, and to renovate and expand her shop.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian, vive con su familia, compuesta por su esposo, un hijo de 15 años de edad, una hija de 10 años de edad, ella y su esposo trabajan como comerciantes, tiene una venta de sandalias, chancletas, para ambos sexos, tiene mas de 7 años en esta venta, lo realiza todos los días desde las 6:00am hasta las 3:00pm.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de sandalias para damas, sandalias para bebes, tambien chancletas de baño, este préstamo será un gran aporte para que Lilian pueda realizar la compra y aumentar la variedad en estilos y colores.
Su aspiración es poder tener mayores ingresos de la estabilidad del negocio, para ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios con la oportunidad de superarse.
texts.en:
Lilian lives with her family composed of her husband, 15-year-old son and 10-year-old daughter.  She and her husband work as merchants; they sell sandals and slippers for both genders and have been in business for more than 7 years.   She works every day from 6am until 3pm.

She’s requesting a loan to buy sandals for women and infants as well as bath slippers.  This loan is of great help for Lilian to be able to buy and increase the variety of styles and colors.  Her hope is to earn higher income from a stable business to help with her children’s schooling so they can have the opportunity to do better.

loans.use: to buy sandals for women and infants.

loans.name: Brenda Evelyn

texts.es:
La señora  Brenda tiene 29 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, reside junto a su familia en una comunidad rural del   Municipio de Macuelizo, departamento de Santa Bárbara..
Hace 2 años inicio su negocio de venta ambulante de productos de uso personal como: lociones, cremas hidratantes, desodorantes, champú, gel, tintes y tratamiento para el cabello.
Doña Brenda ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de más inventario y así lograr surtir completamente su negocio.
Ella se muestra satisfecha con el desarrollo de sus ventas y clientela, ya que las utilidades que obtiene le permiten sobrevivir junto a su familia.
texts.en: Brenda, 29, is married and has two children; she lives with her family in a rural community in the municipality of Macuelizo in Santa Bárbara Department.  She started selling personal use items like lotions, creams, moisturizers, deodorants, shampoo, gel, hair coloring and hair treatments from place to place two years ago.  Brenda is requesting a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy more stock inventory to completely stock her business.  She is satisfied with the development of her sales and her clientele because profits earned allow her and her family to subsist.

loans.use: to buy products (lotions, creams, deodorants, gel and hair treatments).

loans.name: Arcelis

texts.es: Arcelis es una mujer de 39 que vive en Barranquilla, ciudad de la costa caribeña de Colombia. Ella tiene dos negocios – un taller de confecciones y la venta de queso. Hace 6 años, asistió a un curso de modistería en una escuela pública en su barrio y simultáneamente a su cónyuge le fue otorgado un crédito, que ella usó para comprar una maquina de coser; fue  así como empezó su negocio de confección. Ella también complementa sus ingresos con la venta de queso, que distribuye a una clientela doméstica, que poco a poco ha ganado.  Arcelis tiene un hijo de 5 años y una hija de 14 años, y por eso es muy importante para ella, que sus negocios tengan éxito, pues quiere garantizar la educación de sus hijos con sus ingresos. También, viven ahora en un lugar muy pequeño, sufriendo el hacinamiento, y espera usar sus ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de la casa y mudarse a un lugar mejor. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crédito de Kiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar materias primas e insumos y elaborar prendas de vestir a un buen precio, porque logrando descuentos puede ofrecerlo a su clientela y si tiene el dinero disponible para hacer su compra ahorrará mucho, en la compra de una buena cantidad de insumos, esta es justamente la razón de éxito de esta inversión. .
texts.en:
Arcelis, 39, lives in Barranquilla, a Colombian coastal city.  She has two businesses: a clothes making shop and she sells cheese.  She took a sewing course six years ago in a local public school and she and her husband took out a loan that she used to buy a sewing machine.  This is how she started her dressmaking business.  She also earns extra income selling cheese that she sells to a domestic clientele she’s gradually built.

Arcelis has a five-year-old son and a 14-year-old daughter and this is why it’s so important that her businesses are successful because she wants to guarantee her children’s education with her income.  In addition, they live in a very small place so are very overcrowded and she hopes to be able to use her income to improve her house and move to a better place.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy raw materials and supplies to make clothing at good prices because by qualifying for discounts she can then pass them down to her customers and if she has money in hand she can save very much when she makes her purchase by buying in volume which is precisely the reason why the investment will be successful.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Deysi Aracely

texts.es:
Deysi, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y venta de panqué, ella vive con sus tres hijos, es madre soltera, las edades de sus hijos son de 15, 10 y 7 años, dependen económicamente de ella, Cuenta con varios años de experiencia en el negocio, lo realiza todos los días.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz para hacer las tortillas, esto le ayudara a incrementar el negocio, ya que tendrá a la mano el material más necesario para hacer las tortillas.
Su aspiración es que sus hijos sigan estudiando con su apoyo, ya que quiere que se superen y tengan nuevas oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Deysi sells tortillas and pancakes. She is a single mother and lives with her three children. The ages of her children are 15,10 and 7, and they depend on her financially. She has several years of experience in the business, and does it every day. 

She is applying for a loan to buy corn for making the tortillas. This will help her to increase her business, as she will have at hand the most necessary ingredient for making the tortillas. Her goal is for her children to continue their education with her support, as she wants them to excel and have new employment opportunities.

loans.use: To buy corn for making tortillas.

loans.name: Elmer Andamir

texts.es:
Elmer, vive con su esposa y un hijo de tres años de edad, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, realizándolo desde hace 10 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am hasta las 3:00pm, o dependiendo de la temporada.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas, para poder cultivar el maíz y frijol, esto le ayudara a tener los insumos necesarios para que el pueda aplicarlos a la siembra y tener los mejores resultados en la cosecha.
Su aspiración es progresar con su familia, que su hijo tenga la oportunidad de estudiar y prepararse profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Elmer lives with his wife and their three-year-old son. He grows corn and beans and has been doing this for 10 years. He works every day from 6:00am to 3:00 pm, or depending on the season. 

He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides, in order to be able to grow corn and beans. This will help him to have the necessary agricultural supplies, so that he can apply them to his crop and have better results at harvest. 

His goal is to move forward with his family, and for his son to have the chance to go to school and be educated as a professional.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Erick Geovanny

texts.es:
El Joven Erick, tiene 23 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en el sector Calpules del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Su actividad principal es taxista y hace un año que se dedica a una segunda actividad económica de venta de ropa de manera ambulante y estacionaria en su vivienda. Su esposa atiende las ventas  en su casa y él en sus horas libres vende de forma ambulatoria.

Él ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras los que invertirá en la compra de camisas, pantalones, blusas y ropa para niños. 
Erick se siente motivado a seguir con su negocio, ya que con las utilidades que obtiene apoya a su esposa con sus estudios y provee el sustento familiar.
texts.en: Erick, 23, is married and has a son; he lives in the Calpules sector of the San Pedro Sula Municipality, Cortés Department.  His main activity is driving a taxi but a year ago he started a second economic activity: selling clothes from place to place and also from home.  His wife does the selling at home and he sells from place to place in his free time.  He has requested a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy shirts, pants, blouses and children’s clothes.  Erick is motivated to continue with his business because profits he earns support his wife’s studies and provide sustenance for his family.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 56 years old, married and has 4 children who are in school.

Vicenta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Vicenta has been in this business for 13 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Vicenta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Menchita

texts.en:
Menchita works hard to support her family. Menchita is married and has a mango buying and selling business in the Philippines. Menchita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell.

Menchita has been in this business for 35 years now.  In the future, Menchita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 43 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Emelia works very hard to provide for them.

Emelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.  Emelia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, bread, soda and other grocery items. 

In the future Emelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like snacks, eggs, canned goods, and other groceries.

NWTF is relisting Letecia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, eggs, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Luis Albino

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, él es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos y apoyar a sus padres, Luis no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja brindando servicios de transporte, él cuenta con un pequeño auto, el cual utiliza como colectivo para trasladar a sus pasajero, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de los servicios higiénicos y una habitación en su hogar; de esta manera Luis podrá contar con un ambiente más adecuado y seguro, que brinde mayor bienestar para su familia, así él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para cumplir su gran sueño de tener un camión y ampliar su negocio de transporte.
texts.en:
Luis is a 23 year old man.  He is single and lives in Ica, within the Parcona district.  He is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to get ahead.  Unfortunately, due to lack of resources Luis was not able to study for a professional career because he needed to help his parents, but he would love to do it.  He likes to play soccer with his friends in his spare time and at times prepares a delicious ceviche to share with his family.

Through his own initiative, and with lots of work and dedication, Luis has been providing transportation services with a small car, which he uses to transport passengers every day beginning in the morning.  He’s able to work about 12 hours a day and believes that things are going well for him because of his experience and good customer service he provides.

Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to build his bathroom and a bedroom in his home.  In this way Luis will be able to have a better and more secure atmosphere in his home, and provide for his family’s well-being.  He will continue working toward making his dream come true, have a bus, and expand his transport business.

loans.use: to add a bathroom and dedroom to his home.

loans.name: Kelly Johana

texts.es: Kelly Johana tiene 28 años y es la madre de 4 hijos entre las edades de 3 y 11 años. Ella y su esposo trabajan mucho para proveer a su familia, diseñando y tallando vidrio en su propio  negocio. Cuando el esposo de Kelly tenía 3 años de experiencia con el vidrio, y Kelly le convenció a empezar su propio negocio, con un crédito se independizaron, comprando las herramientas para poder decorar vidrios para puertas, ventanas y espejos. Aunque era un riesgo, ella tenía razón, pues 3 años después, han logrado mayores ingresos. Primero, ellos diseñan dibujando como va a aparecer el vidrio. Después, hay que esmerilarlo y tallarlo, para finalmente, venderlo a fabricantes de puertas y ventanas. Los sueños de prosperidad de Kelly y su esposo son inmensos, por eso está aplicando  a su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar insumos para su negocio, como vidrio, espejos y bujías. Con más dinero para invertir, ella puede incrementar  la producción y  ganar más, aumentando sus ingresos familiares. Su meta es ampliar su negocio para poder mejorar la vivienda y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Kelly Johana is 28 years old. She is the mother of four children that are between 3 and 11 years old. She and her husband work a lot in order to provide for their family, designing and carving glass in their own business.

When Kelly's husband had 3 years of experience with glass, and Kelly convinced him of starting their own business, they became independent with a credit, buying the tools to decorate glass for doors, windows and mirrors. Even though this represented a risk, she was right, because 3 years later, they have achieved a higher income. They first design by drawing how the glass will look like. Then, it has to be polished and carved, and finally sold to doors and windows manufacturers.

Kelly and her husband's dreams of prosperity are huge, that is why she is requesting her first credikiva with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy supplies for her business, such as glass, mirrors and spark plugs [used for carving the glass]. With more money to invest, she can increase the production and earn more, increasing her family's income. Her goal is to expand her business so she can improve her family's house and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business, such as glass, mirrors and spark plugs.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 29 years old and married with two children.  Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Mercy has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from videoke, billiards and raising pigs.

Mercy aspires to saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Hermosilla

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Hermosilla works hard to support her family.

She has a 'tricycle' rental business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Hermosilla is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her 'tricycle'.

Hermosilla has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her 'tricycle'.

loans.name: Amihan

texts.en:
Amihan is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and other grocery items to sell in her general store.

NWTF is relisting Amihan's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy is 50 years old. She is widowed and resides with five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been making palm cake to sell for more than three years, earning approximately $7.00 per day. Three of Soy's children are construction workers. They earn about $6.00 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Soy is requesting a loan of $700.00 to purchase piglets for breeding and resale when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn extra income for the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase piglets for breeding and resale when they gain weight.

loans.name: Pumamarca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PUMAMARCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Jeronimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina ella es conviviente y tiene 27 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras como zanahorias,tomates,cebollas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería de forma ambulatoria en la puerta de uno de los mercados de la ciudad de  Cusco, la socia a la vez se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas ,la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que más le solicitan ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de de esta forma que la socia  saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como zanahorias al por mayor.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la agricultura, venta de verduras, crianza de animales menores, venta   de flores, carpintería, construcción.

Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta son socios que pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión de equipo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Pumamarca” which is located in the District of San Jeronimo in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Vicentina is one of the members. She is 27 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children. Vicentina divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling vegetables such as carrots, tomatoes, onions, and other products. She has been in this business for years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. Vicentina sells her merchandise as a street vendor at the entrance of one of the markets in the city of Cusco. She also spends some time raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. The animals are sold to customers who often request them. Vicentina is a responsible and industrious individual who works in this manner so that she can move her family forward.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise, such as carrots in bulk. The other members engage in businesses that involve agriculture, selling vegetables, raising small animals, selling flowers, carpentry, and construction work.

The members who appear in the smaller attached photos requested permission to arrive late to the team meeting.

Vicentina is grateful to those who have helped to fulfill her dream, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, such as carrots, in bulk.

loans.name: Norella Patricia

texts.es:
Hace 6 años, Norella Patricia se dio cuenta de que su vivienda estaba bien ubicada para ofrecer una sala de internet, y que no habían otras en el barrio. Ella abrió entonces  su sala, ofreciendo a sus clientes servicio de comunicaciones por internet, fotocopiaje y llamadas a celulares. La sala funciona  todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 9 de la noche. Es mucho trabajo pero a Norella no le importa, porque tiene que proveer ingresos, para apoyar el bienestar de su hijo de 10 meses, y por eso está intentando incrementar sus ingresos, para establecer unos montos de ahorros mensuales – y algún día, si gana suficiente dinero, obtener su propia vivienda.  
Norella necesita y está aplicando a un crédito de Kiva,  para adecuar la infraestructura de su sala: va a comprar una impresora, un computador y créditos para llamadas internacionales, porque quiere ampliar la cobertura de su negocio, con el fin de  que sus clientes estén muy satisfechos y cada vez más confortables. Este sería el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su razón de éxito radica no solo en su capacidad de trabajo y en sus propias motivaciones, sino también porque existe un potencial de mercado, que aun no ha explorado,  porque su capital de trabajo no ha sido suficiente para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Six years ago, Norella Patricia noted that her house was well-situated for an Internet access room and that there were no others in the neighborhood.  She opened providing her customers with photocopying services, Internet access service and mobile phone calls.  It’s open every day from 8am until 9pm.  It’s a lot of work for Norella but she doesn’t mind because she has to earn income to provide wellbeing for her 10-month-old son and this is why she’s trying to increase her income to be able to set aside a monthly amount to save and someday, if she earns enough money, to buy her own house.

Norella is applying for the Kiva loan she needs to properly equip her Internet access site.  She will buy a printer, a computer and credits for international phone calls because she wants to expand coverage of her business so that her customers will be more satisfied and comfortable each time.

This would be the first financing she gets from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and success for her resides not only in her capacity for work and her own motivation but also because market potential exists that she’s not yet explored due to insufficient capital.

loans.use: to buy a printer, a computer and international phone call credits.

loans.name: Alcira Isabel

texts.es: Alcira tiene 4 años de experiencia en la venta de almuerzos. Ella decidió empezar su propio negocio vendiendo alimentos a sus vecinos en el barrio donde habita, porque tiene mucho talento culinario, y quería aprovecharse de esto para generar ingresos. Cada día, ella va de compras en las tiendas del barrio, y cocina con verduras carnes, pollo, tubérculos, deliciosas sopas y más para vender directamente a sus clientes desde su casa. Para complementar sus ingresos, ella también alquila lavadoras a sus vecinos, quienes las trasladan directamente desde la casa de Alcira hasta su domicilio. Alcira está aplicando a un credikiva, primer un préstamo que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  arroz por bulto, aceite, y otros ingredientes. También invertirá en la compra de 2 lavadoras más, para alquilarlas y ganar un poco mas, teniendo en  cuenta que  su clientela en este servicio ha crecido. Con la capacidad de comprar por bulto, ella puede aprovechar mayores  descuentos, y también puede ahorrar en transporte. Si ella puede ganar suficientes ingresos en sus negocios, obtendría a futuro su propia casa.
texts.en:
Alcira has four years of experience selling lunches. She decided to start her small business selling food to her neighbors in the part of town where she lives. This is because she has a great talent for cooking, and wanted to take advantage of this to generate income. 

Each day she shops at the neighborhood stores and cooks delicious soups and more, with vegetables, meats, chicken and tubers. She sells directly to her customers from her home. 

To complement her income, she also rents washing machines to her neighbors, who take them directly from Alcira's house to their homes. 

Alcira is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she is taking out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, by means of which she will buy rice in bulk, cooking oil, and other ingredients. 

She will also invest in the purchase of two more washing machines, in order to rent them out and earn a little more; taking into account the fact that her clientele for this service has grown. 

With the ability to buy in bulk, she can take advantage of greater discounts, and can also save on transportation. 

If she can earn sufficient income in her businesses, she will acquire her own home in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk, cooking oil and other ingredients.

loans.name: Wuillian Alexi

texts.es:
Wuillian, vive acompañado con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a realizar viajes expresos en moto taxi, este oficio lo inicio como estrategia para poder ayudar a su familia, ya que no tenia empleo, hasta el momento le ha sido muy útil estar como motorista.
El necesita invertir en su moto taxi, para poderlo tener en buenas condiciones, esto le ayudara para poder mejorar el servicio a los clientes y mayor seguridad al viajar, el solicita un préstamo para poder pagar mecánico y comprarse los repuestos que sean necesarios. 
Su aspiración con el préstamo es poder mejorar el servicio con el moto taxi, mantenerlo en buenas condiciones, en su familia quiere siempre tener la facilidad de transportar personas, que son las que le generan ingresos para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Wuillian lives with his wife and 2 children.  He provides short trips for passengers in his moto taxi.  He chose this business strategically so that he could help his family, because he had no job.  So far, working as a moto-taxi driver has been very profitable.

Wuillian needs to invest in his moto taxi to keep it in good condition.  This will help him to provide better service to his customers, and will increase his safety on the road.  He is requesting a loan to pay a mechanic and buy the spare parts that are needed.

Wuillian hopes that with this loan he will be able to provide better service with his moto-taxi by maintaining it in good condition.   For his family, he wants to always have the ability to transport people, as this is how he generates the income to cover the expenses for his household.

loans.use: to pay for a mechanic and spare parts for maintenance on his moto-taxi

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

She has been in this business for 17 years.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetables garden.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married with 6 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Vilma is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Vilma has a personal products business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy perfumes, body lotion, bags, shoes and other personal products.

Vilma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, body lotion, bags, shoes and other personal products.

loans.name: Jocely

texts.en:
Jocely is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items like pants, T-shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

NWTF is relisting Jocely's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, T-shirts and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert lives in the Mariakani area of Coastal Province, Kenya. He is married and has seven children. He owns a tree farm, a business he has been operating for four years.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. Gilbert joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the lack of farming equipment and water.

Gilbert is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy tree seedlings and connect water for planting the seedlings. His extra income will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family and pay school fees for his children. He aspires to buy a bigger parcel of land for farming and dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy tree seedlings and connect water plant the seedlings.

loans.name: Agapao 3 Group

texts.en:
Franck, age 33, is single with three children between the ages of 7 and 14.  All three of his children are attending school.  Franck is representing the Agapao 3 group.  He has a small bakery where he sells cakes and pastries.  He has been operating this bakery for three years.  He will use the loan to buy flour, sugar, butter, and yeast.  His business strategy is to produce a lot of cakes and other sweets for people to buy.  The larger the number and variety of things he offers, the more customers he attracts to his stand. 

This is Franck's first loan with HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner.  His group and HOPE feel confident he will repay the loan.  Franck dreams of building a large business that his children can inherit one day.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cakes and pastries.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Milagros requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like biscuits, bread, soft drinks, and other groceries to sell in her store. Milagros has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like biscuits, bread, soft drinks, and other groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 42 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. Gina is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Gina has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Now Helen is borrowing 15,000 PHP to buy more fish for her dried fish business. The general store business that was previously funded with an NWTF loan has provided Helen and her family with income that has improved their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her dried fish business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, pasta, cold meats, sweets, biscuits.

loans.name: Liliana Yanira

texts.es:
Liliana, tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo, tienen un hijo de 5 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de sal junto con su esposo, venden por mayoreo a las tiendas y negocios, lleva ya 5 años de experiencia trabajando de lunes a viernes.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de Sal por mayoreo, esto le ayudara dándole los recursos económicos para incrementar sus inventarios y poder continuar vendiendo a los clientes.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio, ha logrado tenerlo por 5 años y espera continuar con la ayuda de estos préstamos creciendo, en su familia tiene por objeto poder mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Liliana is 27 years old. She lives with her husband, and they have a five-year-old son. She and her husband sell salt. They sell at wholesale to stores and businesses. She has five years of experience, working from Monday to Friday. 

She is applying for a loan to buy salt at wholesale. This will help her by giving her the financial resources to increase her inventories, enabling her to continue selling to her customers. Her objective is to improve the business. She has managed to have it for five years and hopes to continue growing with the help of these loans.

For her family, her goal is to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy salt.

loans.name: Kafunda Small Christian Community Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 36-year-old married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a builder and has been in service for 10 years. He acquired experience and skills from a vocational school, and now he gets contracted to build. He does not get paid by his clients until the work is finished, so all costs while the work is in progress are his. 

He has a problem with customers not paying on time and high initial costs. However, with the money earned from his previous contracts he has been able to buy land and construct a permanent house for residence. Joseph intends to use the requested loan to pay employees who help him in building.He is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to pay his employees who help him in building.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Leonora works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from renting her boarding house. Leonora is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell in her general store. Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a resident of the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has an eight year old who attends school. She operates a salon business, a business that she has been operating for 5 years. Apart from the salon, she also runs a clothes/cosmetics shop.

Zainab learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are seasonal business climate and competition from other businesses of the same nature.

Zainab is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan Shillings to buy hair chemicals, creams, shoes, clothes, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings and improve her standard of living. She aspires to open other branches in the future.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals, creams, shoes, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 30 year old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda.  For five years he has been in the transport business.  With the income earned, he has been able to buy land, build a house and pay school fees for his children.  He faces the challenges of mechanical breakdown and high taxes imposed by authorities.Charles says that if he had enough money, he would leave the sector, venture into mechanised agriculture and set up a retail shop.  He would like to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification.

Charles intends to use the loan to buy land for crop growing.

loans.use: to buy land for crop growing.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ester works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Ester is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fruits like banana, mango, watermelon, apple and pineapple to sell in her food stall.
