texts.es: David de 22 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y hermanos, él es un joven bastante trabajador y responsable quien trabaja junto a su padre. David se dedica a la siembra de maíz, maicillo y frijoles, actividad a la cual desde que es muy joven ha realizado y  a su corta edad cuenta con gran experiencia en el oficio. David solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el capital necesario para invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como: abono, herramientas, regaderas y otras. Este negocio es muy importante para David y su padre ya que es gracias a este como han podido salir adelante y contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida estable.
texts.en:
David is 22 years old and lives with his parents and siblings. He is a very hard-working and responsible young man who works with his father. David is dedicated to cultivate maize, sorghum, and beans, activity that he has being doing since young and thus at his young age he has an extensive experience in the job. 

David is requesting a loan so he can have the capital needed to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, tools, watering cans and other. This business is very important for David and his father because is thanks to it that they have been able to get ahead and have everything for a stable life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and agricultural tools.

loans.name: Hipólito

texts.es:
El señor Hipólito es originario de la ciudad de San Luis Potosí tiene ya mas de 15 años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Tiene una bonita familia que esta integrada por su esposa y dos hijos de pequeña edad una esta en el preescolar y la otra en primaria, desea darle lo mejor. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo porque tiene un problema con la tubería de agua y necesita cambiarla colocar tubos nuevo y de mejor calidad. 
El señor Hipólito trabaja en una compañía de trasporte como chofer de un camión de carga, tiene ya más de dos años elaborando con la empresa. Con el sueldo que recibe una parte será para pagar el crédito y lo demos para gastos familiares y escolares.
Desea mejor el patrimonio de su familia y que tengan un mejor lugar donde vivir.
texts.en:
Hipólito is a native of the city of San Luis Potosí but has been living for more than 15 years in Nuevo Laredo.  He has a beautiful family made up of his wife and two young children, one in preschool and the other in elementary school.  He wants to give them the best.

He's requesting a loan because he has a problem with his water pipes and needs to install new and better-quality pipes.

Hipólito has more than two years of experience working for a transportation company as a truck driver.  Part of his salary will be to pay back the loan and the rest for family and school expenses.

He wants to improve his family's inheritance and he wants them to have a better place to live.

loans.use: to install water pipes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more materials such as sand, soil, fire wood and rice husks and also some agricultural products to be sold.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 28-year-old food kiosk owner in Mariakani. She is married and is a mother to four children who are aged 12, 11, seven and two years respectively. She has been operating the food kiosk for the past five years with great success. 

This is Mariam’s second business loan from KADET Ltd. and she plans to renovate her food kiosk and purchase more chairs and tables so that she is able to accommodate more clients. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business further and pay her children’s school fees. 

She hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: To renovate her kiosk and purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise: sacks of rice, sugar, noodles, and tuna, among other things

loans.name: Taem

texts.en:
Taem is 41 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up pigs for more than twenty years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $9 per day. 

Taem is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase fodder to use for breeding pigs. In addition, a part of this money will be used to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get higher education.

loans.use: to purchase fodder to use for breeding pigs.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
A 50-year-old, Esmeralda is married with three grown-up children. She lives in the mountainous region of Isabela. She has managed a store for nine years. Aside from the store she is also involved in farming with her husband. 

To expand her business Esmeralda is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional products to display in her store.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, drinks, coffee, sugar and snack foods for her store.

loans.name: Allanie

texts.en:
Allanie is a devoted wife. She expresses her commitment and full devotion to her business and to her family as well. Allanie has operated a small sari-sari (variety) store for eight years. The profits earned from her businesses allow her to pay school fees and allowances for her children. She has two children. 

At this moment, Allanie wants to strengthen her business but has inadequate funds, so she is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs. She wants to stock more items in her store to meet all her customers' requests. 

In the future, Allanie aims to have a large store to earn a higher revenue. She wants to achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to buy soap, shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana (54) is a mother of four children. Three of the children are working and the other one is still at school. Adriana initiated a cake selling business after her husband retired from his job six years ago. The business really helps her in generating more income for her family. 

Every morning, Adriana gets up at 4 am to produce cakes such as donuts, fried banana, bread, steamed sponge, fried yam etc. Adriana utilizes a wooden table to put the cakes on, and sells them in front of her house. The cakes usually sell out around 8 am. Adriana is happy in running the business as her skill is improved and she can serve the customers. 

Adriana plans to add more cakes to sell but part of the capital that she has was spent on her daughter’s school fees. Adriana then went to TLM and requested a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000 to purchase cake ingredients i.e. flour, margarine, eggs, etc in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase cake ingredients such as flour, margarine and eggs in bulk.

loans.name: Ana Walkiria

texts.es: La joven Ana de 28 años estudia la carrera de licenciatura en informática y computación, empezó a trabajar a los 18 años de edad ahora se desempeña en una zona franca como responsable de seguro social. Ella está solicitando crédito para poder pagar su curso de titulación, ya que su carrera es muy importante por que es una oportunidad de poder obtener un mejor trabajo con mayores ingresos económicos para ayudar a la familia, agradece a AFODENIC y KIVA que vienen brindando oportunidades de progresos a muchas personas.
texts.en:
The young Ana is 28 years old and is studying a computer science degree. She started working when she was 18 years old and now she works in a free trade zone as a social insurance responsible. 

She is requesting a loan in order to pay her degree. Her careeer is very important because it's an opportunity to get a better job with higher income to support her family. She is grateful to AFODENIC and KIVA which have been providing opportunities for progress to many people.

loans.use: to pay for her degree.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and animal husbandry for more than four years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a firewood vendor who earns about $3 each day. 

Thou is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase fertilizer to use for farming. In addition, a part of this money will be used to pay for hiring a farm worker. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use for farming.

loans.name: Vong

texts.en: Vong is 47 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in breeding pigs and making creels to sell for more than four years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 daily. Her children are construction workers. They earn about $9 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Vong is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old and a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Taracicio, a business man. They are blessed with five children. She has been a mixed crop farmer for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family.  

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET Ltd. customer. Jane will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a greengrocer business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
To make a living, Myrna has operated her general store for more than fourteen years. She earns PHP 300 each day in the business, which is being rolled into revolving capital to maintain the business. She is 59 years old and is married with five children. 

To expand her retailing, she is taking out this loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase stock such as canned goods, groceries, noodles, shampoo and spices to sell. Myrna hopes to further grow her general store and to increase her income, which will secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as canned goods, groceries, noodles, shampoo and spices to sell.

loans.name: Uuganzaya

texts.en:
Uuganzaya is a 21-year-old student of Architecture. This year is her graduate year, so the tuition fee of her university has increased. Thus she couldn’t fully pay her school fee. 

She lives with her grandma and younger brother in the outer ger district. Her grandma says: "My granddaughter is very ambitious and hardworking. She really loves her major and she is one of the famous students of her university."

loans.use: to pay her last tuition fee

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 49 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Alfred has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells a local drink called waragi. 

To help expand his business, Alfred has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items like molasses that will help in making the local drink to sell, and will help Alfred to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Alfred hopes that in the future he will be able to expand into  a bigger business. 

Alfred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alfred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items like molasses that will help in making the local drink he sells.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
Norma, está solicitando un crédito para poderlo invertir en insumos para la elaboración de la venta, comprara los panes carnes, verduras, aguacate, aceite, condimentos, esto nos permitirá mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le dio un efecto positivo no al negocio, ya que sus ventas han aumentado y han logrado agregar el comercio de agua y de bebidas, considera estar mejorando aunque a futuro quiere también ampliar el local para agregar más productos.
texts.en:
Norma is applying for a loan, so that she can invest in supplies for her business making fast food. She will buy bread, meats, vegetables, avocados, cooking oil, and condiments. This will allow her to improve the selection in her shop.

She says that the previous loan had a positive effect on her business, as her sales increased, and she has managed to add the sale of water and drinks. 

She thinks things are getting better, although in the future she wants to also expand the shop, in order to add more products.

loans.use: To buy bread, meats, vegetables, avocados, cooking oil and condiments.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has six children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Sophie has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Sophie has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes to sell, and will help Sophie to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Sophie hopes that in the future she will be able to to become the richest business woman in town. 

Sophie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sophie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima lives at Mabantad with her parents. To make a living, her brother provides daily motorcycle transport services to the people in their village. This way, the family earns about PHP 300 each day and has just enough for meals and daily expenses of their family household. Fatima would like to make improvements in their business so that their income will increase, too. 

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for franchise renewal and buy tires and crude oil for the motorcycle. The rest of her loan will be used to buy frozen food to sell for extra income. She would like to ensure safe travel for the passengers and for her brother as well. Fatima is also praying for good health and a happy family.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and buy tires and crude oil for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
Hanaa is 22 years old from Gaza. She is married and lives with her husband's big family. 

She asked Ryada for this start-up loan loan in order to help her open a beauty salon. She needs to buy dyes, make-up, hair dryers, and other needed tools for the salon. She hopes that this loan will help her start a good business and thus improve her income, allowing her to move to another house with her husband and children.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources into at least 50 percent of the start-up enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to buy dyes, makeup, hair dryers, and other tools needed for the salon.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 50-years-old business lady. She is married to Robert a business man. They are blessed with two children. She has been running a retail shop for the past four years with the monthly income of KES.10,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lucy will use the loan to buy more stock of maize flour and cooking oil for sale. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour  and cooking oil.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 44-year-old mixed-crop farmer. He is married to Monica, a business lady. They are blessed with two children. For the past ten years, he has been involved in farming as a primary business. He also has a secondary business as a green grocer. His monthly income is 8,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Richard will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to expand the grocery business and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Jerry Gregorio

texts.es: Jerry Gregorio de  42 anos de edad, casado con una hija de 12 anos, del departamento de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, León se caracteriza por ser una zona turística. Orgullosamente tenemos la catedral de León como patrimonio de la humanidad. Jerry es un hombre muy trabajador, responsable, el desempeña como técnico de proyecto de un organismo. Jerry esta solicitando  financiamiento para realizar mejoras a su casa de habitación para brindarle mayor seguridad y estabilidad a su familia. Mejoras que no la ha podido hacer por falta de recursos económicos, las mejoras consisten en hacer un cuarto para su hija porque no tienen ninguna privacidad todos duermen en el mismo cuarto. Con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como: hierro, zinc, cemento, alambre, arena, madera bloques.  Jerry agradece la  ayuda que brindan los inversionistas  kiva a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Jerry Gregorio is 42 years old, married with one daughter who is 12 years old and he is from the department of León, a place that is located in the western part of the country.  León is characterized as being a tourist area that proudly has the Cathedral of León as a World Heritage Site.  

Jerry is a very hardworking and responsible man.  He serves as the project technician for an organization.  Jerry is requesting financing to make some improvements to his home in order to provide his family greater security and stability, improvements that he hasn’t been able to make because of a lack of economic resources.  The improvements consist in making a room for his daughter because they don't have any privacy since everyone sleeps in the same room.  With the financing he will buy construction materials like rebar, corrugated metal roofing, wire, wood and cinderblocks.  

Jerry is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people of limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in home improvements and to buy construction materials like corrugated metal roofing, cement, sand and cinderblocks.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 36-year-old business lady who sells fresh produce. She is married to Pius, who is a business man. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a green grocer business for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 6,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Emma will use the loan to buy more vegetables and fresh fruit for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fresh fruit.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma and her husband are blessed with eight children. They live in the village of Mabantad.  Vilma raises pigs and also farms rice and corn. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase feed and additional piglets to support her business. Her goal is to expand her pig-raising business to maintain her income and support the needs of her family. Vilma said she must be strong and work hard in order to achieve her dreams, just like well-known entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional piglets to support her business

loans.name: Hach

texts.en: Hach is 48 years old, married, has three children and resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fruit for more than four years, earning approximately $7 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. In order to improve her business, Hach is requesting a loan of $500 to raise capital in her business to purchase more fruit to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. She hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire field hands.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: José Roberto de veintidós años de edad vive junto a su hija, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que permite obtener las mejores cosechas, además cuando no cultiva se dedica a trabajar de jornal para complementar los gastos del hogar, el terreno de siembra esta ubicado en un lugar de alto potencial agrícola, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque todo el producto es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un excelente servicio; José es un hombre entregado a su labor, luchador día a día se esfuerza por salir adelante sabe que solo con esfuerzo y constancia logrará  el éxito que tanto desea, en esta temporada de siembra quiere aprovechar y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. José Roberto tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
José Roberto is 22 years old, and lives with his daughter. He is a farmer; he grows corn in particular. He has several years of working in this area, and that has given him a great deal of experience that allows him to obtain the best harvests. In addition, when he's not farming, he works as a day laborer to further contribute to the household expenses. 

His farm land is located in a place with high agricultural potential. He sells in all the areas surrounding the community. He already has a considerable clientele, as people prefer him because all his product is top-quality, affordably priced, and the service is excellent. José is a man dedicated to his work: striving every day, he does his best to succeed. 

He knows that only with effort and perseverance will he achieve the success he so much desires. He wants to make best use of this planting season, and carry out a new investment. But he needs working capital, and that is why he is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy corn seed, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc. 

José Roberto has good payment references, and says that he will be able to pay back the debt. At the same time he is confident that he will give his family a better life.

loans.use: To buy corn seed, fertilizer, insecticide, and tools.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 30 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, one child currently in school. For the past nine years, David has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells timber. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2500, 000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber for resale, and will help David to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. David hopes that in the future he will be able to be more independent. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more timber for resale.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence's group consists of two hard-working women. Florence is 17 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell, and will help Florence generate greater profits and pay school fees for her younger siblings. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger business. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jose Lucas

texts.es:
José, están solicitando un préstamo por que inicia su cultivo de maíz y de Maicillo, para esto deberá invertir en los insumos necesarios como el abono, herbicidas, y preparar el terreno, además invertirá en la compra de repuestos para el taller de bicicletas como frenos, forros, pedales, entre otros que son necesarios para poder prestar un buen servicio.

El manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le dio un efecto positivo a su negocio, hasta el momento han logrado mantenerse su deseo de superarse, de mejorar el taller, y continúa en la espera de poder realizarce a través de varios préstamos.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan because he is starting to plant his corn crops and he needs to buy supplies, such as fertilizer, pesticides, and needs to prepare the land.  He will also buy spare parts, such as brakes, covers, pedals, and other things for his bicycle repair shop, allowing him to provide good service.

He says that the previous loan had a positive effect on his business and up to now he has been able to maintain his desire to succeed, to improve his workshop, and continue in hopes of developing himself with the help of various loans.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and bicycle repair parts.

loans.name: Gregoria Arely

texts.es:
Gregoria, siempre continua en su negocio, elaboración de pupusas, para esto solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar la compra de maíz, aceite, un comal de metal, y en otros productos que sean necesarios para la venta, espera tener un buen resultado de esta inversión.

Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudó para poder mejorar el negocio y mantener un buen nivel en el inventario, sus clientes han aumentado y el servicio considera que lo está mejorando día con día.
texts.en:
Gregoria is still continuing with her business making pupusas (thick handmade corn tortillas stuffed with fillings like cheese and pork).  For this, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase corn, cooking oil, a metal griddle, and other products that are necessary for her business. 

She hopes to have good results from this investment. She says that the previous loan helped her to improve the business and maintain a good level of inventory. Her customers have increased, and she feels that she is improving service day by day.

loans.use: To buy corn, cooking oil, and a metal griddle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавчуда женщина в возрасте 40 лет.  Она замужем и  имеет троих детей.  Её муж работает  водителем городского маршрутного такси.  Мавчуда занимается торговлей.  Продаёт на рынке детскую одежду, которую привозит из другого города  раз в месяц.  Она  узнав у соседей по бизнесу о кредитах обратилась в Арванд за поддержкой.  На полученный кредит решила съездить за товаром  и завезти новый ассортимент зимней детской одежды. В дальнейшем Мавчуда планирует расширить  своё место продажи путём увеличения ассортимента одежды. Заранее благодарит за финансовую одежду.
texts.en:
Mavjuda is a woman of the age of 40. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a driver for a town shuttle bus ("marshrutka"). Mavjuda is engaged in trade. She sells children's clothing, which she brings in from another city once a month, at the market. 

After having learned from her neighbors about taking business loans, she turned to "Arvand" for support. For the loan received, she decided to go and get goods and bring a new assortment of children's winter clothing. In the future, Mavjuda plans to expand her point of sales through increasing the assortment of clothing. She thanks you in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase children's winter clothing

loans.name: Udita

texts.en:
Udita is 17 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Udita has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells all types of clothes. 

To help expand her business, Udita has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more dresses and blouses, which will help Udita to generate greater profits, develop her business and offer a wider variety of clothes. Udita hopes that in the future she will be able to maintain or grow her current level of business. 

Udita is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more dresses and blouses for her shop

loans.name: Juntos Para Crecer Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Veronica, es socia del grupo "Juntos para crecer", reunidos con un mismo proposito que es salir adelante y tener estabilidad economica para poder cubrir sus primeras necesidades.
Veronica tiene 34 años, tiene 2 hijos pequeños. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, para poder cubrir los gastos de sus pequeños hijos, ella consiguió un poco de dinero e inició éste negocio con muy poca mercedería la cual ofrecía a sus amigos y conocidos, poco a poco fu{e aumentando su stock como sus clientes.
Uno de sus grandes sueños es tener una boutique, en un local propio.
El prestamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir para damas para atender unos pedidos y para tener en stock.
En la fotografia ubicaremos a Veronica en la parte central, con una chaqueta de color rosado y con sus bebe en la espalda.
texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the “Juntos para crecer” group, formed for the common purpose of getting ahead and having the financial stability needed to cover their primary needs.

Veronica is 34 years old and has two small children.  She has been selling clothing for the past four years and in this way is able to cover her children’s expenses.  She had a little bit of money and used it to start this business with just a few products.  She began by selling to her friends and acquaintances and increased her stock and her customer base little by little.  One of her greatest dreams is to have a boutique of her own.

She will use the money from this loan to buy articles of clothing for women to fill some orders and to have some items in stock.

Veronica is in the middle part of the photograph, wearing a pink jacket and with her on her back.

loans.use: INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE ROPA PARA VENTA

loans.name: Fredi

texts.es: El sr. Fredi tiene 38 años de edad, él vive en la población de cesarzama ( entrada a puerto alegre), de la provincia carrasco, de la ciudad de Cochabamba, él se encuentra concubinato con la sra. Adela con la cual tiene 4 hijos,  Fredi y su esposa se dedica a la Agricultura, producción de Banano, producción de Cítricos, El señor fredi tuvo problemas con su anterior cosecha. El préstamo que solicita Fredi es para la excavación de drenaje para banano y de esa manera podrá tener más ingresos y poder ayudar a sus hijos a terminar alguna carrera sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos ya que el no pudo terminar una carrera, pero él quiere que sus hijos si puedan realizar una carrera y poder ayudar a las personas de la zona.
texts.en:
Mr. Fredi is 38 years old and he lives in the town of Cesarzama (on the outskirts of Puerto Alegre) in the province of Carraso and the city of Cochabamba. 

He lives with Ms. Adela with whom he has 4 children. Fredi and his wife work in agriculture, producing bananas and citrus fruits. Fredi had a problem with his last harvest. The loan that Fredi is requesting is for the excavation of a drainage system for banana trees and in that way he will be able to have better income and help his children finish their schooling.  He dreams of a better future for his children since he was not able to finish school, but he wants his children to be able to pursue a career and to be able to help other people in the area.

loans.use: to excavate a drainage system for planting banana trees.

loans.name: Nasario

texts.es: El señor Nasario de 30 años de edad es casado con la señora Edilfreda hace 7 años ambos con una instrucción de nivel primario, tienen 2 hijos dependientes, la familia vive en Pueblo de Mosoj Rancho-Candelaria hacia el norte de Colomi. El señor Nasario y su esposa son agricultores tienen ingresos económicos de la venta de papa, papaliza, haba, oca cultivando en terreno de herencia de sus padres con rotación de cultivos de acuerdo a cada producto a la vez el señor realiza servicio de transporte de pasajero de la comunidad de Candelaria hacia Colomi los días de feria jueves y domingos. Don Nasario necesita, para construir una vivienda (cocina) porque el ahorro que invirtió en compra de insumos agrícolas; Por último el don Nasario mas la esposa se sintió muy feliz nos dicen que siempre lucharan para tener un futuro mejor por delante.
texts.en:
Sr. Nasario is 30 years old and has been married to Sra. Edilfreda for seven years.  They both have an elementary school education.  Nasario has two dependent children and lives with his family in the town of Mosoj Rancho-Cadelaria, which is north of Colomi.  

Sr. Nasario and his wife are farmers who generate income by selling potatoes, beans, and oca (a root vegetable grown in the Andes) produced on the land that he inherited from his parents.  They rotate their crops according to the season.  Nasario also provides passenger transportation services from the community of Candelaria to Colomi on Thursdays and Sundays, which are the days when the fairs are held.  

Don Nasario wants to build a kitchen, but his savings are being invested in farming supplies.  He and his wife say that they are pleased to be striving toward a better future ahead of them.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a kitchen in his house.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia es soltera y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en la casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como abogada por más de ocho horas al día realizando todo tipo de trámites, ya que debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de sus habitaciones ya que las paredes se encuentran muy deterioradas y desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Patricia, es mejorar sus ingresos y adquirir una casa en anticretico para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Patricia is single and has two children who are school age.  She lives in her parents’ house occupying two bedrooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Sopocachi zone.

She currently earns income working as an attorney for more than 8 hours daily doing all sorts of transactions because she must cover her family’s education, food and basic utility costs.  She needs the loan to refurbish her bedrooms because the walls are very deteriorated and she wants to improve her quality of life.

Patricia’s dream is to improve her income and to acquire a house under the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] to provide more comfort for her family.  This is her fourth loan with IMPRO and second with KIVA.

loans.use: to refurbish her bedrooms at home.

loans.name: Cintya

texts.es:
Cintya, es soltera y está esperando un bebe , viven en casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Chamaco Chico de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a la venta de insumos para la canasta familiar ya que cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes trabajando por más de doce horas al día y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia. La tienda está funcionando bien, pero ahora está un poco baja en productos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería para su tienda, como ser arroz, azúcar, fideos al por mayor ya que desea continuar el nivel de  sus ingresos para posteriormente independizarse y darle más comodidad a su futuro hijo ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Cintya es ampliar su tienda, tenerla bien surtida y eventualmente convertirla en un pequeño supermercado.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Cintya is single and is waiting for the arrival of her baby.  She lives at her parents’ house which consists of only one room.  The house is located in the District of Chamaco Chico in the city of La Paz.

Cintya currently generates income by selling household goods from a grocery store where she works more than 12 hours a day.  Through her work, she is able to pay for food, education, and basic services for her family.  The store is operating well, but now she is running a little low on products.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise for her store such as rice, sugar, and noodles in bulk.  She wants to maintain a level of income that will allow her to become independent and provide more comforts for her son so that they both can have a better quality of life.  

Cintya dreams of expanding her store, keeping it well-stocked, and eventually converting it into a small supermarket.  This is the third time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 36-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Lucia, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with one child. He has been in the farming business for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 19,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. James will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for the farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy another piece of land for farming and to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mower to clear his land.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
José, quiere invertir más en su negocio, ya que su deseo de superación en el comercio espera realizarlo a través de la buena inversión de la utilidad de los préstamos, con él se comprará zapatos y ropa, variados para ambos sexos y en el caso de los zapatos de varias tallas, en el caso de la ropa prendas variadas y colores y estilos.

Con el préstamo anterior aumentaron las ventas y las ganancias con lo que le han permitido hasta el momento mantener una mejor condición de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose wants to invest more into his business and hopes to succeed through the help of these loans.  He will use the money to buy various sizes of shoes and various colors and styles of clothing for both genders.

The money from the previous loan helped to increase his sales and profits, and provide a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada ocupando una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de maní confitado ya que trabaja por más de diez horas vendiendo de forma ambulante y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de educación y alimentación de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de maní y azúcar por cantidad ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos para posteriormente adquirir una casa en anticrético ya que ahorrara en el pago de alquileres.
El sueño de Miriam es tener su casa propia para dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la décimo cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la  tercera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Miriam is married and has 2 children who attend school.  They live in a rented home, occupying one room.  Their house is located in the Pasankeri neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Miriam currently works selling candied peanuts.  She sells from place to place, working more than 10 hours a day.  With her earnings, she must cover the food and educational expenses of her family.

She needs a loan to buy peanuts and sugar in bulk, because she wants to increase her income so that in the future she can acquire a house through an anticrético (an arrangement where the renter pays a lump sum "loan" to the landlord in lieu of rent, where the loan is secured by the property being rented).  This way, she could save on rent payments.

Miriam's dream is to have her own house, so that she could provide greater comfort to her family and improve their quality of life.

This is the 10th loan that she has requested from IMPRO, and the third time that she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and sugar to make candied peanuts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es viuda y tiene un hijo que esta en la universidad, viven en una casa alquilada ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Ciudadela Ferroviaria de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como empleado en una entidad pública por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora portátil ya que le será de mucha ayuda en sus actividades laborales.
El sueño de María es mejorar sus ingresos para adquirir una casa en anticrético ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida y tener más comodidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria is a widow, and has a son who is attending the university.  They live in a rented home, occupying two rooms.  The house is located in the Ciudadela Ferroviaria neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Maria currently earns income working as an employee of a public entity for more than 8 hours a day, because she must cover the food, education, and basic services expenditures for her family.

Maria needs a loan to buy a laptop computer, because this will be a great help to her in her work activities.

Maria's dream is to increase her income so that she can acquire a house through an anticrético (a special type of lease arrangement), because she wants to improve her quality of life and have more comfort.

This is the first time that Maria has requested a loan jointly from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a computer to help her with her job

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.es:
Jeannette es soltera  y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en dos habitaciones alquiladas en la zona San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente tiene ingresos de sus dos vehículos de los cuales percibe una renta diaria ya que es la única que cubre los gastos de alquileres, educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia. Anteriormente ella tenía una sola movilidad pero ahora tiene dos y son utilizadas para el trasnporte de pasajeros.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de uno de sus vehículos ya que desea cambiar el motor y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos para el mantenimiento de su familia.
El sueño de Jeannette es adquirir una casa en anticrético para el ahorro de alquileres y también  dar más comodidad a sus hijos y  mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la sexta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la cuarta vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jeannette is single and has two school-aged children. They live in two rented rooms in the San Martín area of the city of La Paz.

Currently, she has income from her two vehicles, from which she earns a daily rent. She is the only one who covers her family's expenses for rent, education, food and payment of basic services. 

She needs the loan for maintaining one of her vehicles, as she wishes to replace the engine, and this way improve her income for supporting her family.  

Jeannette's dream is to acquire a house through an "anticrético" (the occupant makes a lump-sum payment to the owner up front, as a loan in return for housing. The owner must repay it after a specified period, usually two years).  This is in order to save on rent, and also to provide her children with more comfort and improve their quality of life.   

This is the sixth time she is applying for a loan with IMPRO, and the fourth time with Kiva.

loans.use: To replace the engine of one of her vehicles, and to do maintenance.

loans.name: Samuel Nigo

texts.en:
Samuel is a 38-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of two and nine. One of them goes to school.

Samuel runs a general store and has been in business for three years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase oil, onions, and many other inventory items. He has no additional source of income other than this business.

In five years, Samuel would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices.

Samuel says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more inventory items such as oil, onions, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cloth for her new business

loans.name: Edigina

texts.en: Edigina used her previous loan to purchase a motorcycle. She has had a charcoal-selling business which she says has earned her a good profit. Now, she is requesting a new loan to buy sacks of charcoal, and other supplies she needs to sell charcoal. This would allow her to have a stock of inventory, get discounts for quick payment, and offer quality products to her customers who have become accustomed to her products every day.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and other supplies she needs to sell charcoal.

loans.name: Delma

texts.es:
Delma, es casada y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en la casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Alto Chijini de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como secretaria por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe ayudar con los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de una habitación en la vivienda de sus padres para tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida, para lo cual comprará ladrillos, cemento, arena, fierro y otros insumos, ademas de pagar a los constructores.
El sueño de Delma, es mejorar sus ingresos para mudarse a una casa en anticrético y dar más comodidad a sus hijos.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Delma’s married and has two, school age children.  They live in her parents’ house occupying two bedrooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Chijini zone.  She’s currently employed as a Secretary and works more than 8 hours daily since she must help with her family’s food, education and basic utility costs.

She needs the loan to add a bedroom to her parents’ house to have more comfort and improve her quality of life.  To do so, she will buy bricks, cement, sand, rebar and other supplies as well as pay the builders.  Delma’s dream is to improve her income so she can move into a house under the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] to provide her children with more comfort.  This is her first loan request to both Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, and sand to build an additional room in her parent's home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Cosmas Mawa

texts.en:
Cosmas is a  42-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has four children between the ages of 2 and 12. Three of them go to school.
Cosmas runs a general store and has been in business for four years. He has no employee. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3000 SDG to purchase oil, onions, dry fish and other items. He has no other source of income besides this business.
In five years, Cosmas would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high transportation costs. Cosmas says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: for buying more items like oil, dry fish and onions

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en:
Zaitun is a married woman who lives in Samburu, Kenya at her rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Zaitun has operated a charcoal-selling business in her house for the past six years. She has a charcoal store and wants to be able to enlarge her store so that she can continue providing for her children.

She is requesting this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and other goods to sell in her store. She and her family appreciate the assistance that they're receiving.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and other goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and vitamins.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Femme d’un docteur, adjovi âgée de 32ans est maman de 02 enfants. Ils sont âgés de 07 et 03ans et seul le premier est scolarisé. Elle vend de façon ambulante des pagnes aux clients de part et d’autres de la ville de Lomé. Elle sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des pagnes. Avec les profits, elle veut avoir une boutique de vente de pagnes et acheter un terrain.
texts.en:
Adjovi is married to a doctor, and is 32 years of age. She has two children who are 7 and 3 years of age, and only the eldest child is at school. 

Adjovi works selling “pagnes” [traditional wrap-around cloth] on the street, and her customers live all over the city of Lomé. She has asked for her first loan to buy pagnes, and plans to use the profits to open a store to sell her cloth and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy “pagnes” [traditional wrap-around cloth].

loans.name: Maricela Guadalupe

texts.es: Maricela Guadalupe  de  36 anos de edad, madre soltera con 2 hijos de 20,15 los cuales están bajo su responsabilidad y  estudian. Maricela se desempeña como docente de una escuela de la localidad. Es una mujer muy luchadora, trabajadora, con muchas responsabilidades como madre soltera para poder formar a sus hijos y brindarle un futuro mejor. Maricela esta solicitando el financiamiento para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación las cuales consisten en reparar el portón de la puerta principal de su casa, y la reposición de dos puertas de los cuartos ya que están totalmente deterioradas por la polilla. Estas mejoras la han querido realizar desde que adquirió la propiedad pero por falta de recursos económicos no los ha podido hacer. Maricela ya ha trabajado con fundación lo cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. Los sueños de esta mujer  es terminar y ver formados a sus hijos en profesionales y terminar de reparar su casa de habitación para tener un techo digno donde vivir. Con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como tubos galvanizados, puertas de madera, clavos, alambre. Maricela Guadalupe agradece la ayuda que  brindan los inversionistas kiva  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua que posee tantas limitantes.
texts.en:
Maricela Guadalupe is 36 years old and the single mother of two children, ages 20 and 15.  She cares for both of them and both attend school.  Maricela works as a teacher at a local school and is a very hardworking woman with many responsibilities as a single mother.  She wants to provide a better future for her children.

Maricela is asking for this loan to make improvements to her home, including repairing the front door, and replacing two doors that are completely rotted due to moths.  She has wanted to make these improvements since she acquired the property, but has not been able to do so due to lack of financial resources.

Maricela has worked with the foundation before and has demonstrated that she is responsible when it comes to making payments on time.  Her dreams are to see her children have professional careers and to repair her home and have a dignified roof under her head.  She will use the money from this loan to buy galvanized pipes, wooden doors, nails, and wire.  Maricela Guadalupe appreciates the help that the Kiva lenders have provided to those people in poor countries like Nicaragua, who face limits.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Saidakhon

texts.en: Saidakhon is 21 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Her family has a good quality of life but her parents' incomes are not enough for improving their living condition. Saidakhon decided to start new business sewing women dresses in order to generate an income she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied and learned business skills. She is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatima is an entrepreneur who has made progress toward her goal thanks to her capacity for work and love for her family. She is married and has two children. She is the owner of a tailoring business that generates income for the family. She began the business nine years ago. She requested a Kiva loan to buy cloth material for making dresses. She will be able to get substantial discounts by buying in large volume and this is the groundwork for the success of her Kiva loan that has her enthused and dreaming.

loans.use: to buy cloth material for making dresses.

loans.name: Ayawovi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale, des condiments et autres produits à domicile, madame Ayawovi âgée de 42ans est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants dont 02 sur les bancs d’école. L’ainé est âgé de 22ans et le dernier 13ans. Les demandes des clients deviennent de plus en plus importantes c’est pour cela, elle sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour  acheter des produits d’alimentation générale, des condiments afin de satisfaire les besoins de clients. Avec les profits, elle compte emmagasiner  des marchandises tout en assurant le bien être de la famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Ayawovi sells basic food items, condiments and other wares out of her house. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of three children, two of whom are still in school. The eldest is 22 years old, and the youngest 13. The demand for her goods keeps growing, which is why she is seeking a second loan from WAGFES in order to buy basic food items and condiments to meet her customers’ needs. She plans to use her revenues to build a stock of merchandise and also to provide for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic food items and condiments.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: la Sra. Flora tiene 51 años y es Casada con 3 hijos que son de las edades de  28, 23 y 17 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera  necesidad , donde  Vende Refrescos Pilas, Galletas, chicharrones y todo lo que sirve para los viajeros que viajan a los Yungas en su tienda de  barrio que se encuentran en  la zona de Villa Fátima, este préstamo es  su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Flora va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería, como dulces y refrescos y también para la compra de un  mostrador para exhibir sus productos para su negocio, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo, la Sra.  Flora enfrenta retos en su negocio que son los ambulantes que venden en el mismo lugar que ella, lo cual perjudica su venta porque no puede dejar su negocio debido a la abundancia de ladrones por la zona y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería para surtir su tienda, para vender sus productos. Su deseo  es ayudar a sus hijos menores a ser independientes y responsables.
texts.en:
Flora is 51 years old, married, and has three children ages 28, 23, and 17.  She sells primary needs products such as soft drinks, cookies, fired pork rinds, and things that travelers need to travel to the Yunga mountains.  Her store is located in the Villa Fátima zone.  This will be her first loan thorough the institution and she will use the money to buy merchandise such as candy and soft drinks, and also a display case to display her products.

She is asking for this loan because she is short on cash.  Flora faces challenges in her business, including completion from others who sell in the same location.  This affects her sales.  She also can’t leave her business unattended because of the number of thieves in the area.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise for her store so that she has more products to sell.  Her desire is to help her children become independent and responsible.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Nolvia Eliseni

texts.es:
Nolvia, necesita invertir más en el negocio, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo que le permita comprarse harina fuerte, harina suave, manteca, azúcar, y otros productos necesarios para la elaboración del pan, este nuevo financiamiento le ayudara a mejorar la disponibilidad de materiales y la producción.

Con el préstamo anterior logro tener una buena experiencia, realizo una buena inversión que le ayudo a mejorar la producción y las ventas, su situación económica en la familia se mantiene en condiciones estables.
texts.en:
Nolvia needs to invest more in her business, so she is asking for a new loan that will allow her to buy flour, lard, sugar, and other things she needs to bake bread.  This new loan will help her improve her availability of products and production.

The previous loan was a good experience for her.  She made a good investment and it helped her improve production and sales.  Her family financial situation is stable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Gulafzo

texts.ru: Гулафзо 29 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. С детства она мечтала стать портнихой. Несколько лет назад она научилась шить национальные женские платья. Гулафзо решила организовать свой бизнес и  с такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условия проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulafzo is 29 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. From childhood, she dreamed of becoming a seamstress. A few years ago she learned to sew women's national dresses. 

Gulafzo decided to set up her own business and with this aim she attended the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. For the income, she plans to improve her living conditions. She requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni for the purchase of a sewing machine, in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for setting up a new business

loans.name: Hiam

texts.en: Hiam is a 56-year-old married woman from Ashrafia in Amman, Jordan who has 2 family members. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to repaint her home. In the future, she wants to provide a good living environment for her family.

loans.use: to repaint her home.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a hardworking, enterprising person. Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, she has been able to better stock her store with the items she needed. She is once again asking for a loan from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance so she can buy rice, pasta, sugar, flour, and drinks at wholesale prices. This will allow her to have a well-stocked store and earn more money.

Dzame is grateful to Yehu and Kiva for providing this new opportunity.

loans.use: to buy rice, pasta, sugar, flour, and drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: La Sra. Wilma tiene 26 años soltera,  se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Wilma va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Wilma va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Wilma es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Wilma is 26 years old and single.  She sells cosmetics through a catalog on foot, visiting homes and public and private offices in the city of Santa Cruz.  This will be her first loan through the institution and Wilma will use this loan to buy cosmetics and jewelry in quantity, which she can get on sale.  In this way she will be able to increase her earnings and continue improving her business.  She will continue to use the benefits to buy a variety of beauty products.  Wilma is a very hardworking woman who is happy about this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy inventory in quantity.

loans.name: La Reconnaissance Group

texts.en: Zephyrin, age 50, is married with 2 children, who are 14 and 17 years old and currently attend school. He is representing the La Reconnaissance group. Zephyrin has a stand in the market where he sells food. He has been selling in the market for over 10 years and has acquired a good reputation and loyal customers. Zephyrin will use the loan to buy seasonal fruit, palm oil, and beef. His business strategy is to sell his 2-3 day old meat to one of his group members who has a restaurant. He sells it at a cheaper price, but still makes a small profit. He would normally make a loss on this meat and have to throw it away.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit, palm oil, and beef to stock his food stand.

loans.name: Ismael Antonio

texts.es: Ismael Antonio de treinta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas,  cuando no trabaja en sus cultivos labora de jornal y albañil pues eso le ayuda a completar los gastos del hogar, el terreno donde siembra esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se h hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; Ismael es un hombre activo, entregado a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, piensa trabajar con esfuerzo y constancia para no rendirse en el camino; en las ultimas cosechas tuvo muchos problemas y perdidas y desea recuperarse, hará una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. Ismael tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: 37-year-old Ismael Antonio lives with his life partner and his children. He grows corn and beans. He has worked in agriculture for several years and he has gotten valuable experience, which allows him to obtain the best crops. When he's not working on his crops, he works as a day laborer and a bricklayer, because this helps him pay for his household expenses. The plot of land where he sows is located in a highly agricultural area that's very close to his home. He makes his sales in all the neighboring areas and he has gotten a lot of customers. His customers prefer to go to him because everything he sells is high quality at accessible prices, and he provides good service. Ismael is an active man who's dedicated to his work and has a lot of drive to get ahead. He's always seeking opportunities that allow him to succeed. He believes in working hard and persistently so that he doesn't give up halfway through. In the last few harvests he had many problems and losses, and he wishes to recover. He'll make a new investment which will allow him to increase production. For that reason he requests a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can purchase corn and bean seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc. Ismael has a good credit record and he guarantees that he'll be able to repay the debt. At the same time, he hopes that he'll bring financial stability to his household.

loans.use: to purchase corn and bean seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and tools.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco, se le presenta la necesidad de comprarse un vehículo, para esto solicita un préstamo porque solo dispone de una parte del dinero y con el aporte del préstamo completara el valor, esta inversión es importante para Marco porque en el vehículo transportara el pan distribuyéndolo a los clientes.
El efecto que le dio el préstamo anterior fue positivo, realizo las mejoras en la vivienda con la construccion del corredor, logrando tambien mejorar la producción del negocio, hasta el momento su economía familiar ha mejorado, pero necesita poco a poco ir mejorando mas.
texts.en: Marco needs to buy a vehicle. He is applying for a loan because he only has part of the money, and with the contribution of the loan, he will have the whole sum. This investment is important to Marcos because with the vehicle he will transport bread, distributing it to his customers. The effect from his previous loan was a positive one. He made the improvements in the home by building a hallway, and he was also able to improve the production of the business. The household economy has improved, but it needs to improve more little by little.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle in order to distribute his bread.

loans.name: Angel Daniel

texts.es:
Ángel, comprara un nuevo pedido de mercadería para el negocio, por esta situación solicita un préstamo que le facilite el dinero para realizar la compra de contado en productos como: arroz, azúcar, papel, bebidas, y otros productos para surtir el negocio.
El comenta que la experiencia en los prestamos ha sido positiva, ya que en este periodo se ha permitido surtir el negocio, actualmente su estructura familiar está bien, ha mejorado considerablemente su economía.
texts.en:
Ángel will use the money from this new loan to buy merchandise for his business, such as rice, sugar, paper, drinks, and other products to stock his store.

He says that his experience with these loans has been positive because it has allowed him to stock his business. Currently his family structure is sound and its financial situation has improved considerably.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: John Kinyata

texts.en:
John is a 39-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10 who all go to school. John runs a general store and has been in business for 4 years. He has no employees and the business is his only source of income. John heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers and is taking a loan of 3000 SDG to purchase clothes, a sewing machine, and other items.
In five years, John would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high transportation costs. John says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as clothes, sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Fayroz

texts.en: Fayroz is a 54-year-old widow who supports one family member. She is from Al Bayader Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JD to pay for home improvements. She wants to repaint her home and to do maintenance. In the future, she hopes to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Roxana Emperatriz

texts.es:
Roxana, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio, además de también reparara el vehículo con el que trabaja, ella invertirá en la compra de frutas frescas, mangos, papayas, manzanas, también comprara verduras y además ira al mecánico porque el vehículo en el que transporta la mercadería está fallando.
Ella espera que con el crédito pueda mejorar su negocio, ya que el anterior le dio los recursos para que realizara una buena compra, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado pero necesita continuar estabilizando su economía.
texts.en:
Roxana has decided to get a new loan in order to invest it in her business. Besides, she'll also repair the vehicle that she uses for work. She'll use the loan to purchase fresh fruit, mangoes, papayas and apples. She'll also purchase fresh vegetables, and aside from that, she'll seek a mechanic, because the vehicle with which she transports the merchandise is breaking down.
She hopes that with this loan she'll be able to improve her business, since the previous loan provided her with the resources to make a good purchase. Her financial conditions have improved, but she needs to keep on becoming more financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, papayas, apples and fresh vegetables, and to do maintenance on her vehicle.

loans.name: Luis German

texts.es:
Luis tiene 47 años, ha cursado la secundaria. Está casado con María de 45 y tienen 3 hijos, juntos viven en la Parroquia de Jordán en el Cantón Otavalo de la Provincia de Imbabura. Otavalo es una ciudad muy atractiva por la diversidad de su cultura por lo que es muy concurrida por turistas nacionales y extranjeros quienes en cada visita disfrutan de paisajes, fiestas coloridas y las costumbres de sus habitantes indígenas y mestizos que provienen de legendarias historias y que han defendido su territorio desde siempre. Es un cantón muy rico económicamente pues desde sus antecedentes ancestrales, fue considerado el centro de la industria artesanal y actualmente estos productos son cotizados en todo el mundo.  También el turismo es una industria que aporta a la economía de esta ciudad, pues en la zona rural se pueden encontrar ríos, lagos, cascadas, bosques que son muy visitados. Por la afluencia de turistas, comerciantes y habitantes de la ciudad, en el centro de la ciudad se puede encontrar gran variedad de negocios que tienen el objetivo brindar todos los servicios para quienes pasan por la ciudad, estos negocios varían entre hoteles, hostales, restaurantes, cafeterías, papelerías, tiendas de ropa, alquiler de computadores, internet, etc. 
Luis presta el servicio de alquiler de teléfono para llamadas nacionales e internacionales a números fijos y móviles a través de locutorios con cabinas telefónicas ubicadas en su local que emprendió por iniciativa propia y ya tiene 13 años, en el cual permanece 8 horas diarias. Aparte del servicio de teléfono también se ofrece útiles de papelería y copias, valores agregados con los cuales sus clientes pueden sentirse cómodos recibiendo un servicio completo. Luis como fruto de su trabajo a lo largo de estos años obtuvo una vivienda a la cual necesita hacerle algunos arreglos en la estructura, para lo cual solicitó un préstamo en Fundación Alternativa con el cual podrá cumplir este objetivo y con quienes además recibirá asesoría y capacitación que pondrá en práctica en el desarrollo de su microempresa para destacarse de la competencia que en la actualidad ha crecido en el sector.
texts.en:
Luis, 47, completed secondary school.  He’s married to María and they have three children.  They live together in Jordán Parish in Otavalo Canton in Imbabura Province.  Otavalo is a city that’s very attractive because of its diverse culture; it’s very well-known by both national and foreign tourists who visit different vistas, colorful festivals and the culture of its indigenous and mestizo peoples that come from legendary histories and who have defended their territory since time immemorial.  

It is an economically rich canton because it’s been a center of craftsmanship since its most ancient origins and its products are today highly prized worldwide.   Tourism is another industry that contributes to this city’s economy because in this rural zone can be found rivers, lakes, waterfalls and forests that are highly visited.  Because of the high number of tourists, merchants and residents in the city, one can find downtown a great variety of businesses that have as their main goal to offer all services to those passing through the city.  These businesses range from hotels to inns, restaurants to cafeterias, bookstores, clothing stores, computer rentals, Internet access, etc.

Luis provides telephone rental services for national and international land lines and mobile phones by means of phone booths located in his locale that he started on his own initiative and has now been in operation 13 years; he’s open 8 hours daily.  In addition to the phone services, he also sells paper goods and photocopies which are added values his customers can feel satisfied with for obtaining a complete service.

As fruit of his long years of labor, Luis acquired a house that currently needs some structural improvements which is why he’s requested a loan from Fundación Alternativa so that he can reach this goal.  He will also get advice and training from them that he will be able to put into practice in his micro business in order to stand out from the competition which has currently grown in the sector.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es: Don Eladio es de la comarca San Gabriel, se dedica a sembrar maíz, frijol y trigo desde hace 35 años, padre de 6 hijos. Con las ganancias como jornalero fue ahorrando hasta logra comprar sus vaquitas. Para hacer sus huertas le ayuda un hijo y paga mozos que le ayuden y cuando saca la cosecha de maíz, frijol y  trigo la lleva a vender a Tipitapa y Boaco además vende sus cuajadas propias de la leche que le producen sus vacas. Hoy don Eladio está solicitando este crédito para comprarle concentrado a las vacas y para pagar mano de obra para limpiar los potreros él dice que el crédito le será de ayuda porque podrá darle un mejor cuido y alimentación a sus vacas.
texts.en: Eladio is from San Gabriel district; he has worked growing corn, beans and wheat for 35 years.  He’s the father of six children.  With savings earned working as a day laborer he was able to buy his cows.  One of his sons helps him with the orchards and he hires day laborers to help him when the corn, beans and wheat is to be harvested; he sells them in Tipitapa and Boaco.  He also sells curd made from his own cow’s milk.  Eladio is now requesting a loan to buy feed for the cows and to pay labor costs to clear the pastures.  He says the loan will help him because he will be able to better care for and feed his cows.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and pay labor costs to clear the pasture.

loans.name: Beja

texts.en: Because of his need to generate an income to improve his family’s well-being, Beja began his business selling charcoal. Beja is a married man who has four children. His main clients are the neighboring community members.  Beja is requesting his fourth loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization he has been part of for years. Yehu Microfinance Trust made it possible for him to set up his business in order to give his family a more comfortable environment. He will use the money to buy sacks of charcoal for resale. He wants to increase his opportunities in the market, such as responding to new customers who have been referred by the current buyers and those whose attention he wants to capture.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mola

texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Mola bought sacks of maize that he sold, increasing his working capital slightly. He was able to start a charcoal selling business, which has been so profitable. Now he is applying for a new Kiva loan because his sellers have requested more products for their established clientele, and Mola's working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

This is the reason why his Kiva loan will be successful, because he will respond to demand by buying sacks of charcoal at a good price. Mola tells the lenders that his Kiva loans have been very useful to him. He says thank you and may they continue helping him.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 47-year-old married woman who supports three family members from Al Bayader Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JD to buy materials to make pastry to resell in her area.  In the future, she would like to expand her project to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pastry to resell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana del municipio de San Pedro Sula.
