He is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate the shop and increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de comestibles,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años ne este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de comestibles.La socia solicita le credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas.

La socia esta feliz con el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to make her living at her grocery store business.  She sells basic need items like rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.  She works from 5am until 10pm.  She's been in this business for several years, and her dream is to expand her grocery store business.  

She is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.  She is happy with this loan granted to her and commits herself to paying the installments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.

loans.name: Santos Antonio

texts.es: Santos Antonio vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y ya tiene varios años de experiencia en la agricultura lo que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde  esta ubicado posee un gran potencial agrícola y esta cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios pero sobre todo por el excelente servicio siempre a la orden de los clientes; Santos es un hombre dedicado a su labor, enérgico, con muchas metas que desea alcanzar, todos los días se levanta con la esperanza que al final del camino obtendrá el éxito, en la temporada de siembra pasada tuvo muchas perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permite comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramientas etc. Santos Antonio tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Santos Antonio lives with his life partner and his son. He grows corn and beans. He already has some years of experience in farming, and this allows him to obtain better harvests. The land where he farms has great agricultural potential and is close to his house. He trades in all the areas around the community. He already has many customers, since people prefer him because of the quality, the good prices, and above all the excellent service, always at his customers' disposal. Santos is a man who is dedicated to his work, energetic, with many goals he wants to achieve. Every day he gets up with the hope that at the end of the road he will be successful. During the last season, he had a lot of losses, and he wants to recuperate from them. For that reason, he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that allows him to buy corn and bean seed, manure, insecticide, tools, etc. Santos Antonio has good payment references. He assures us that he will be able to pay the debt. At the same time, he has faith that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seed, manure, insecticide, and tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy ready-made garments to sell

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana una mujer que trabaja en el campo de la agricultura, casada, vive en Sololá con su esposo y sus hijos ya que son 8, dos de ellos casados y los otros seis  de ellos  tres mujeres y tres hombres quienes trabajan con ella en la agricultura.
Ella se dedica al cultivo de  brócoli, maíz, frijol y flores que se cultivan  en la región, esto es en el área del terreno que tienen con su esposo. 
Estos son los principales ingresos familiares ya que  ella nos cuenta que  es la primera actividad productiva que le enseñaron los padres desde que tenía 15 años y con el pasar del tiempo contrae matrimonio y trabajan conjuntamente con su esposo.
Ella ve su necesidad de tener más capital para seguir cultivando la cual solicita un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para comprar semillas de brócoli, abono orgánico, insecticidas y más.
Ella nos comenta que entre sus metas esta: seguir invirtiendo en mas cultivos para generar mas ganancias, también construir una mejor vivienda para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is a woman that works in the field of agriculture.  She is married and lives in Sololá with her husband and her eight children.  Two of her children are married and the other six, three women and three men, work with her in agriculture.

She makes a living cultivating broccoli, corn, beans and flowers that are grown in the region.  This is in the area of the land that she has with her husband.  This is the principal family income as she says that it is the primary profitable activity that her parents taught her when she was 15 years old and with the passage of time she got married and works together with her husband. 

She sees her need to have more capital in order to continue cultivating.  She is requesting a loan of $6,000 GTQ to buy broccoli seeds, manure, insecticides and more.  She comments that among her goals are:  to continue investing in more crops in order to generate more income and also to build a better home for all of her family.

loans.use: to buy broccoli seeds and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Los Vencedores De Carabayllo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Marlene Aurora, tiene 41 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos. Ella es socia del grupo "Los Vencedores de Carabayllo" formado por cinco socios, todos ellos residentes del distrito de Carabayllo.
La Sra. Marlene Aurora se dedica desde hace dos años a la atención y cuidado de ancianos, para lo cual estudió y se preparó para poder ayudar con sus conocimientos a los ancianitos. Tiene diversas experiencias tanto buenas como tristes pero considera ser parte de su trabajo.
Ella necesita equiparse con instrumental y materiales para los diferentes cuidados que imparte, para lo cual solicitó el crédito, éstos instrumentos son costosos por lo que poco a poco irá los irá adquiriendo.
texts.en:
Marlene Aurora is 41 years old and has three children.  She is a member of the group "Los Vencedores de Carabayllo" [The Victorious of Carabayllo], formed by five members who are all residents of the Carabayllo district.

Marlene Aurora has made a living for two years in the attention and care of the elderly.  She studied and prepared herself to be able to use her knowledge to help the elderly.  She has diverse experiences, both good and sad, but she considers this to be part of her job.

She needs to equip herself with the instruments and materials for the different types of care that she gives, which is why she requested the loan.  These instruments are expensive; therefore, little by little she will acquire them.

loans.use: to buy instruments and materials to carry out her work of caring for the elderly.

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en:
Borrower Tumenbayar is a 44-year-old widow who has two daughters and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She has higher education in both accounting and nutrition technology. Her youngest daughter attends the Royal Academy in Mongolia, while her eldest daughter helps Tumenbayar to run her business.   

Regardless of her profession, she has had six years of experience in her own grocery and home furnishing store, until she went to South Korea for five years for a higher-paying job. After she came back from S. Korea in 2010, she continued her small grocery store business. 

Tumenbayar is requesting a 3,900,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) loan to buy more merchandise for the grocery store. Her goal is to improve her business in order to increase her working capital and expand her business as well.

This is her third Kiva loan. She is really thankful and appreciative of the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for the new school year

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 45-year-old married woman. Five years ago, she started her own business of cut-piece clothing sales at a time when her husband was jobless. She didn't lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to start her own business. She buys clothes of different designs from the market in bulk at lower prices and sells them in her community and at the local market. She has a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors.

Her husband has also been doing business with her for the last three years. He has good experience in business and good marketing skills. She is the mother of five children (two sons and three daughters), two of whom are attending school.

She has gradually improved her business, and has now requested a loan of Rs. 50,000. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of clothes in a larger quantity to add to her current ones. She intends to use the profits earned for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy an ample variety of clothes in a larger quantity

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery materials.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has been running a retail shop, which has served the local community for several years. She says thank you for the loans she is receiving from Yehu and Kiva. Maria was able to add stock to her retail shop, thereby having enough inventory. Thanks to  her efforts, she has also been able to start a charcoal-selling business. She also states that since the previous loan, her living standards have improved. She is requesting a new loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. This way she is sure that she will increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a thirty-seven year old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been operating a drug store for nine years. He started the business in the village with just 150,000 shillings; when his capital increased he moved to town. 

He currently lacks the capital to purchase stock for his customers and pay for high rent and double licenses. He dreams of going back to school and educating his children; for his business, his goal is to hire employees who can help expand his business. 

The purpose of the loan is to increase his stock by buying drugs like painkillers (including Quinine,) Fansidar, and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs like painkillers (including Quinine,) Fansidar and others to sell.

loans.name: Erasmo Antonio

texts.es: Erasmo Antonio de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijas en casa propia; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado basta experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alto potencial agrícola muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un servicio inigualable;  Erasmo es un hombre dedicado a su labor y a su familia, enérgico y luchador tiene muchas metas por delante, le gusta trabajar  duro por lo que desea pues sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito; en la ultima cosecha tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. Erasmo tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Erasmo Antonia is 43 years old and lives together with his life partner and his children in their own house. He makes a living cultivating corn and beans. Erasmo has spent a number of years working in agriculture which has given him a lot of experience and allows him to grow the best crops. The land he cultivates is in a zone with high agricultural potential close to his house. He sells his crops all around his town and already has a lot of customers who prefer to buy from him because what he sells is not only high quality and reasonably priced but offered with unparalleled customer service.  Erasmo is a man who is dedicated to his work and his family. He is energetic and a fighter; he has many goals ahead of him, and he likes to work hard because he knows that this is the only way to achieve the success he wants. During the last harvest he suffered some losses that he wishes to recoup; for this reason he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn seeds, beans, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, etc. Erasmo has good payment references and is very responsible. He is sure that he will be able to repay the debt and at the same time hopes that this loan will help bring his household economic security.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, beans, fertilizer, insecticide, and tools

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married. He owns a transport business which he has been operating for two years. His mode of transport is greatly preferred because of the bad road network which is not accessible by vehicles. Besides this, he also owns a timber-selling hardware. His main challenges are high transport and fuel prices, seasonal weather and finding customers.

Stephen learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. Stephen is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy additional stock of timber. The extra income from this loan will be added to his savings to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of timber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new batch of chicks and equipment e.g. drinking cans.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a resident of Mariakani of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of three children. She owns a butchery, a business that she has been operating for two years.

Jane learned about Milango through a friend, with the intention of accessing credit to improve her business. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, seasonal markets, purchasing stock and the high cost of transportation. 

Jane is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase additional beef for sale in her butcher shop. The extra income she will earn from the loan will be added to her savings to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase additional beef for her butcher shop to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary.

texts.en: Mary is a fifty six year old widowed lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a clothes selling business, which she has been running for the last fifteen years. Her main hardships are seasonal weather, price fluctuations, and inflation. Besides that, she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets. Mary needs a loan to help her buy more clothes to sell as the Christmas season is fast approaching.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mangoes, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past three years Edith has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells all types of shoes. 

To help expand her business, Edith has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a wide variety of shoes to sell and will help Edith to generate greater profits and use the profits to save for her child's school fees. Edith hopes that in the future she will be able to continue to grow the business. 

Edith is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Samburu in Mombasa, Kenya. She’s a merchant. She has had a store for one year. She is a very hardworking, enterprising person who always strives to the maximum degree to be able to help her family members and to give them everything they need to have a life with no privations or unmet needs.

She’s asking for the loan to buy supplies to stock her store with beverages, canned goods, baked goods and other items to continue having it well-stocked.  She is grateful for the support Yehu Microfinance and Kiva gives her.

loans.use: to stock her store with beverages, canned goods, baked goods and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a 43 year old mixed crop farmer. He is divorced with one child. He has been in the farming business for the past six years with monthly income of KES. 19,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Dominic will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is from the village of Lalog.  She is married to a farmer and they had been blessed with two children.  To make a living, Susana is busy managing their hog-raising business.  She has been doing this for five years.  She usually acquired a net income of PHP 7,000 per head every time she disposed of it.  Susana wants to have more piglets to raise.  To make this possible, Susana is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, and an additional hog to raise.  In the future, she wants to have good financial management and to continue acquiring good income from her business.  She wants to save enough money for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and an additional hog to raise.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María Luisa de 52 anos de edad, casada con dos hijos mayores de edad de 28,26 anos, independiente económicamente. María luisa es originaria del departamento de Chinandega lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona muy productiva económicamente. María luisa se desempeña como operaria de una fabrica y también vende ropa que ella misma confecciona. María luisa se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable. Esta solicitando el financiamiento para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación que consiste en instalar la tubería de aguas negra, y construir la cocina ya que actualmente es una cocina improvisada. Mejoras que no había podido hacer por falta de recursos económicos. Con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como: zinc, bloques, hierro, arena, madera. María Luisa agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recurso y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: María Luisa is 52 years old, married and has two adult children, ages 28 and 26.  They are financially on their own.  María Luisa is originally from the Chinandega department, located in the western zone of the country, a place known for being an economically productive zone.  María Luisa works in a factory and also sells clothing that she herself makes.  She is a very responsible and hardworking woman and is asking for this loan in order to make improvements to her house, such as installing sewage pipes and building a kitchen.  She currently has an improvised kitchen.  She has not been able to make these improvements due to lack of financial resources.  She will use the money from this loan to buy building materials, such as zinc metal sheeting, cinder blocks, iron bars, sand and lumber.  María Luisa is grateful to each of the Kiva lenders who help people of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 38 years old, and is married to Rexy. The couple is thankful, because they have been blessed with four children. To earn a living, Alma is engaged in a direct selling business. She has been doing this for almost three years and earns about 1,500 PHP a month. Right now, Alma is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy detergent soap, powder and shampoo to sell. In the future, Alma aims to have more products to sell and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy detergent soap, powder and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Horacio Manuel

texts.es:
Horacio es un joven de 21 años, es soltero y por costumbres y tradiciones de la comunidad a la cual pertenece, alcanzó a terminar la escuela primaria. Vive en el cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador, es una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios y ahora son microempresarios que aportan a la generación de empleo. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra y además que es la tercera ciudad más habitada en el país. Horacio reside en la Parroquia Luz de América de este cantón, un sector que es considerado como el portón de entrada a la Provincia, por la riqueza de su tierra ha sido el nido de varias empresas productoras de alimentos además que es la zona de mayor producción de papaya, fruta exótica exportada desde aquí. Es por esto que los habitantes de esta parroquia en su gran mayoría, se dedican a la agricultura. 
Horacio siempre ayudó a sus padres en el negocio de la agricultura, el cual se inició por el esfuerzo de la familia desde que Horacio tenía pocos meses de nacido, conforme fue creciendo él también se involucró en esta actividad, por lo que cada día invierte  al menos 6 horas para el cuidado de plantaciones y sus frutos. Horacio está seguro de que sus ingresos pueden incrementar si aumenta a estas labores, la tarea  de criar pollos para su posterior venta, para lo cual solicitó un crédito en Fundación Alternativa en donde encontró el apoyo con la rapidez y seguridad que esperaba, además que fue asesorado para la buena administración de su negocio. Horacio utilizará todos los fondos de este crédito, en la compra de pollos como primer paso para el cumplimiento de su sueño que es tener una granja y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Horacio is a young, 21-year-old man.  He is single.  Because of the customs and traditions of the community to which he belongs, he only studied through primary school.  He lives in the canton of Santo Domingo in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas.  Santo Domingo connects the mountain region with the costal region of Ecuador.  It is a city that has become a main commercial artery with various sectors of growth.  As proof, it has various enterprising families that started small businesses several years ago, and now they are small businesspeople that support the generation with employment.  Studies reveal that the businesses, for the most part, started empirically and have had acceptance due to tourists, businesspeople, and travelers passing through.  They are moving from one region to another, and it is also the third most populous city in the country.  Horacio lives in the Luz de América parrish in this canton, a sector that is considered the entryway to the province.  The richness of its land has been the birthplace of various food companies.  It is also the area that produces the most papaya and exotic fruit for export.  This is why the large majority of people in this parrish make a living through agriculture.

Horacio always helped his parents with their bueinss and also got involved in his business.  Every day, he invests at least six hours in taking care of his crops and fruit.  Horacio is sure that his income can increase if he increases his work, which is raising chickens to sell.  This is why he requested a loan from Fundación Alternativa, where he found support with the speed and safety he was hoping for.  He also received advice on how to manage his business.  Horacio will use all of the funds from this loan to buy chickens as the first step in fulfilling his dream, which is to have a large farm so he can improve his quality of living.

loans.use: to buy chickens to later sell.

loans.name: Adelein Conception

texts.en: Adelein Conception is 39 years old and has one school-aged child. She plans to educate her child and give it a better life. Despite the hardships of her life, she is  striving hard to satisfy her necessities and support the education of her child. To earn additional income, Adelein Conception is in the hog-raising business while she does the household chores. She plans to raise more pigs to sell but due to insufficient capital she has not been able to pursue her plan. Therefore, she is requesting additional capital of PHP 12,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She believes that through this loan she will be able to work out her plan and hopes that she will be successful in carrying it out.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal and to repair the store.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: Desde hace doce años Rogelio se ha dedicado a la producción de café y también es encargado de comercialización de este cultivo en un beneficio. Él está casado y tiene cuatro hijos a quienes ha ido inculcando los conocimientos necesarios para que algún día también se puedan dedicar a la misma actividad. Durante la cosecha pasada Rogelio tuvo una producción de doce toneladas de café orgánico las cuales entregó en su totalidad a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que fueran procesadas y exportadas. A él le gustaría aumentar su producción y para hacer esto posible necesita sembrar nueva planta de café pues algunas de las que tiene ya han cumplido su ciclo de vida. Para llevar esto a cabo necesita un crédito el cual pagará al final de la próxima cosecha. En un futuro a Rogelio le gustaría poder adquirir más terrenos para sembrar café. Entre sus metas personales está la de que sus hijos puedan tener una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Rogelio has worked producing coffee for twelve years.  He's also responsible for selling coffee in a coffee processing plant.  He's married and has four children, whom he has taught the necessary knowledge so that one day they, too, can do the same work.  In the last harvest Rogelio produced twelve tons of organic coffee, which he delivered in its entirety to the Unión Regional de Huatusco to be processed and exported.

He would like to increase his production, and to make this possible he needs to plant new coffee plants because some of the ones he has already have finished their life cycle.  To do this he needs a loan, which he'll repay at the end of the next harvest.

In the future Rogelio would like to be able to acquire more land to grow coffee.  Among his personal goals is for his children to get a college education.

loans.use: to re-plant his coffee farm

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Farming is the primary source of income for Rey's family. He grows corn crops in the village he resides in, and for the past six years has also been raising hogs as his additional source of income. Rey is married and blessed with six children, all of whom he desires to educate because it's the only legacy he can give them.

Rey is requesting a loan of PHP 48,000 to buy hog feed and vitamins to ensure the proper growth of his hogs. He hopes to render them all healthy and free from any diseases so that he can get a good price for them. In this way, Rey will be able to help his children to achieve higher education to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins for his livestock business.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Viajamos desde muy temprano para conocer a Mauricio hasta su negocio cuando llegamos aun no tenía nada puesto ya que nos comenta que se le había hecho tarde. Mauricio es un joven muy alegre pero sobretodo muy trabajador nos platica que tiene 35 años de edad por el momento se encuentra viviendo en unión libre con Jazmín, tiene tres hijos que depende de él. Mauricio nos platica “Me dedico a la venta de ropa americana desde hace 15 años pero atiendo mi negocio de zapatos he inicie mi negocio porque mi padre me enseño ya que él se dedicaba igual al comercio entonces me ayudo dándome un lugar y un poco de mercancía para poder yo emprender mi propia zapatería, solo que mi única dificultad es la falta de financiamiento es por eso que estoy solicitando un crédito a la institución para poder comprar más pacas de ropa americana, me gusta mucho mi negocio porque me agrada ver como mis clientes regresan a comprarme porque fueron my bien atendidos, aunque tengo dos empleadas trabajando en la zapatería les pido de favor que traten bien a los clientes para que ellos regresen contentos a comprarnos, mi meta es hacer crecer mi negocio para que yo pueda darles educación a mis hijos y tengan una mejor calidad de vida” Mauricio está muy agradecido con la institución y con KIVA por el credito otorgado con el crédito el podrá comprar lo que le hace falta.
texts.en:
We traveled from very early to meet Mauricio at his business, when we arrived, he has nothing on as he told us he was running late.  Mauricio is a very happy you man, who above all else is a hard worker.  He tells us that he is 35 years old and for now is living with his partner Jazmín.  He also has three children depending on him.  

Mauricio told us, "I have been selling American Clothing for the past 15 years, but I also attend to my shoe business, that I started because my father taught me since he was also devoted to business.  Therefore, he helped me by giving me a location and some merchandise to be able to start my own shoe store.  However, my one difficulty is my lack of financing, which is why I am applying for a loan from this institution to be able to purchase more packs of American clothing.  I really enjoy my business because it pleases me to see how my clients return because they were so well taken care of.  Although I have two employees working at the shoe store, I ask them to please treat the customers well so they will happily return to the store.  My goal is to grow my business so that I can give my children an education and so they can have a better quality of life." 

Mauricio is very grateful to the institution and to KIVA for the loan granted.  With the credit he will be able to purchase what he needs.

loans.use: will be used to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Mwangari

texts.en:
Mwangari is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He owns a grocery shop which has been in operation for the last three years. He has two children. Mwangari started his business from the savings he made from casual jobs at construction sites. The business now hosts a vegetables and cereals shop.

Mwangari is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenyan shillings to build a store for the new stock. The additional income from this loan will help Mwangari pay for his children’s school fees and also start other projects. His ambition is to become a wholesaler despite the challenge of price fluctuations. He will save the additional income towards the building of a residential house.

loans.use: to build a store for his new stock of vegetables and cereals.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en: Mary Rose is 53 years old, and is married to Jesus. The couple is thankful, because they have been blessed with three children. To earn a living, Mary Rose is engaged in a direct selling business. She has been doing this for almost two years and earns about 1,500 PHP a month. Right now, Mary Rose is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy detergent soap, powder and shampoo to sell. In the future, Mary Rose hopes to have more products to sell and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy detergent soap, powder and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita runs and has operated her home-based store for three years.  Aside from retail she is also planting different kinds of vegetables which she sells within her local community.  Teresita is married and has three children.  Two of her children are married while the third is an overseas Filipino worker.  Teresita's spouse is a carpenter and farmer.  

The couple aims to improve their living condition and to have a stable source of income.  To make their dream possible, Teresita decided to request a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000.  She will use this loan amount for restocking her home-based store so that she can satisfy all of her customers’ demands and be able to encourage more customers to buy her merchandise.  She hopes for continuous access to financial services so that she can be a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her retail store.

loans.name: Trifina

texts.en:
Trifina's family's main source of income comes from their livestock and farming business. She is married and has three grown up children.

Trfina's business has grown which is the reason she put up another business - a retail store - to provide her her family with an additional source of income. She plans to put more stocks of merchandise into it, but her capital is insufficient so she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She hopes that she can expand her retail store and earn greater profits which she can use to cover her family's household expenses, and improve their living condition.  She also hopes to be able to save some money for emergency purposes in the future if she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy necessary merchandise for her retail store business

loans.name: El Arroyito (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama el Arroyito y se integra de  tres señoras quien cada una vive en diferente  barrio  de chicoasen.
 
  Quien ese le como la entre vista es la señora Lorma quien  vive en unión libre con el señor José y con quien procreo   tres hijos quienes aun estaña su responsabilidad  y estudian en secundaria y la mas pequeña a  esta en educación inicial.
 
   Ella trabaja el préstamo hace siete ciclos y comenta que le va bien  ya que en donde lo inviertes es  en la compra de  cosméticos de la marca jafra  en donde lleva trabajando ocho años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello  a estado sacando a delante a su pequeña familia.
 
  Inicio  con esta actividad para poyarse con sus ingresos  y también para brindarle un apoyo a su  esposo  y juntos encargarse de los gastos de su hogar, par que sus hijos tengan los más necesario y sigan estudiando.
 
   Lo que más desea de su actividad es que con el tiempo ella pueda ser distribuidora y darles emplea a otras compañeras que necesitan trabajar.

   Quienes se une al grupo son las señoras: Elisabeth  quien trabaja el préstamo en la compra de  frutas y legumbres y la señora Carolina en la compra de ingredientes para su  cocina económica.
texts.en:
The group is called El Arroyito and is formed by three women, each of them living in a different Chicoasen neighborhood The interviewee is Lorma, who lives in a common-law marriage with José, with who she had three children who are still under her responsibility. They are studying secondary school and the youngest one is in primary school. 

This loan is her seventh cycle and she says she is doing well because she invests it in the purchase of Jafra brand cosmetics, where she has been working for eight years. She says she is doing well because she has been getting her small family ahead thanks to it. 

She started with this business to have her own income and also to provide support to her husband and together take care of the household expenses, so their children have everything they need and they can continue studying.

What she wants the most about her business is to become a distributor over time, so she can hire other colleagues who need a job. The ones joining the group are Elisabeth, who uses the loan to buy fruits and vegetables and Carolina, who buys ingredients for her economic kitchen.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of shoes.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is a 40-year-old married and hardworking woman. She lives with her family in the remote area of Punjab, Pakistan. Her family consists of her husband and 3 daughters. All of her daughters are studying while the husband helps her with her business. Samina has a small business. She sells beauty products like perfumes, a variety of creams, manicure/pedicure products, etc. She believes that her business is doing well because she is very kind to her customers and offers them quality products. For that purpose, Samina, as a member of a 10-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the profits she will pay her house rent and invest more in her sales business. She dreams for her business' growth and her children's good future. She wishes her best to Kiva.

Note: In the picture, Samina is holding a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Lluvia De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LLUVIA DE ORO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de accesorios de celulares, venta de comida, venta de fruta, venta de gasolina, librería, venta de dulces, venta de pastillas, venta de medicamentos naturales, venta de busos, venta de perfumes, venta de jugos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace años por iniciativa propia, ya que este negocio es muy comercial.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, etc.) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Lluvia de Oro" (Rain of Gold) will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes regional center. It is composed of 11 members, and it is directed by a board of directors where Señora Juana is the president. The businesses that the members of the bank run are varied. Among them are selling cell phone accessories, selling food, selling fruit, selling gasoline, bookstore, selling sweets, selling pills, selling natural medicines, selling sports pants, selling perfume, selling juice.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these little microentrepreneurs, of whom Juana is one. She mentions that she joined Pro Mujer two loan cycles ago, joining at the invitation of her friend, who is a member of the institution.  Now she has a business selling food. She states that she began this business years ago on her own initiative, since this business has very good sales.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital, buying rice, noodles, etc, which she will acquire from the distributors, and after preparing her food, she will sell it in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to help her family as much as possible, since she is married and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training in health and credit.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, etc., to prepare food

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 38 years old and widowed with two children, aged ten and twelve years old. She has been selling rice for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 60,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. Caroline will use the loan to buy more rice to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children and expand her business. Her hopes is to be a supplier of rice to supermarkets.

loans.use: To buy rice to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hog raiser within her local community. She has been engaged in this kind of business for three years. Aside from raising pigs, she also offers native cakes and vegetables within her local community. Marites is happily married and has three children. All her three children are studying at school.

Marites' husband is a farmer and a tricycle driver. Sometimes her husband goes to nearby villages to buy empty bottles, cans, and old iron as an additional source of income. She and her husband really desire to succeed in life and in business. Marites has been raising one sow and nine piglets. With the large number of her raised piglets, she is in need of more money. In this regard, she requested a loan of PHP 12,000, which will allow her to buy hog feed and vaccines. In addition, she will use some of the amount to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her vegetable garden. Marites hopes that she will raise her hogs healthy and free from any diseases so she can offer them at a greater price upon reaching their optimum size. As a result of this, she can afford to educate her three children and be able to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and vaccines for her pigs and fertilizer and pesticides for her vegetables

loans.name: Las Almendritas Group

texts.es:
El  grupo se llama  Las Almendritas y se integra de tres personas dos señoras y un señor  quienes viven en  una ribera pequeña pero muy bonita  en donde celebran la fiesta de la santísima Virgen de Guadalupe el 12 de diciembre.
 
   A la señora quien se le tomo  la entrevista se llama Margarita quien es casada con el señor  Rogelio con quien procreo  cuatro hijos quienes dos  ya están casados y dos a un están con ella a su responsabilidad .
 
   Trabajara el préstamo en la compra de  pinturas a automotrices en donde lleva trabajando  dos años y cuatro meses en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello sus ingresos son muy buenos  y ya tiene clientes que le compran en los talleres mecanices.

    Inicio con esta actividad para poder  tener una actividad en donde  sacar dinero  y con ello poder apoyar a su familia en los gastos que se generan en su  hogar.

  Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo y  su actividad ella pueda seguir  trabajando  y con el tiempo hacer más grande su negocio que tanto la poya.

   La señora Mirene es integrante del grupo y su préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes y Don Sebastián invertirá en la compra y venta de pinturas.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Almendritas and it has three members: two women and one man, who live on a small but pretty riverbank where they celebrate the party of the Blessed Virgin of Guadalupe on the 12th of December. 

The woman who was interviewed is named Margarita. She is married to Rogelio, with whom she had four children, two of whom are already married and two who are still with her under her care.

She will use the loan in the purchase of paint for automotives for the place where she has been working for two years and four months, where she states that it is going well for her since with this work her income is very good and she already has clients who buy from her in mechanical shops.

She started with this work to enable herself to have an occupation that would allow her to get money and with it be able to support her family with the expenses that they generate in the home.

What she wishes the most is that with the loan and her tasks, she can continue working and with time expand her business which supports her so much.

Mirene is a member of the group and her loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her grocery store, and Sebastián will invest in the purchase and sale of paint.

loans.use: to pay for car paint

loans.name: Nojoud

texts.en: Nojoud is a 30-year-old married woman who supports two family members. She lives in Jarash, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy women's clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors in the same of area. In the future, she wants to increase her family's income.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 26 years old and single. He has been operating a salon and barber shop business for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of KES 38,000.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy a new shaving machine, blow dryer, and hair chemicals for his salon. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will open more salons. His hope is to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a new shaving machine, blow dryer, and hair chemicals for his salon

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en la agricultura con lo que ha ganando experiencia valiosa que le permite alcanzar las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona con un alto potencial agrícola, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesita a precio realmente accesible, con producto de calidad y un servicio inigualable; Salvador es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, se dedica a su labor con gran esfuerzo pues sabe que así al final del camino encontrara el éxito, como todo buen comerciante quiere aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Salvador tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, se hace responsable del de pago y a la vez tiene fe que le dará familia una misa.
texts.en: Salvador, who is 45 years old, lives with his life partner and their children. He grows corn and sorghum. He has worked in agriculture for a long time, and in this time he has acquired valuable experience that allows him to achieve the best harvests. His farm land is located in a zone with high agricultural potential. He sells in all the surrounding areas of the community, and he has acquired many customers who prefer him because he always has what they need at a truly affordable price, with quality products and unequaled service. Salvador is an entrepreneurial man with a great will to advance. He works with great effort because he knows that this way he will find success at the end of the road. Like all good business people, he wants to increase his production, and this is why he is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy corn and sorghum seeds, insecticides, herbicides, etc. Salvador has good payment references from his acquaintances. He is responsible for the payments, and at the same time he has faith that he will be able to pay to have a mass said for his family.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, insecticide, herbicide, and tools

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
El Esfuerzo es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 6 personas cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica con la intención de obtener mas recursos económicos y brindar a sus familia una mejor calidad de vida, las integrantes de este grupo son: Carolina cría de cerdos, Guadalupe venta de refrescos, María del Rosario venta de dulces, Delfina cría de cerdos, María del Carmen venta de abarrotes, Mariana venta de refrescos. Este grupo se ubica en una comunidad de nombre Guadalupe de Reyes el cual esta ubicado a orillas de las vías del tren.

Doña Delfina es una mujer muy alegre y luchadora, ella tiene la edad de 30 años, estudio secundaria y esta casada con Don Miguel el cual trabaja como jornalero, ellos tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando. Ella platica que hace 2 años inicio a trabajar en la cría de cerdos porque quería ganar un poco de dinero y poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, ella dice "me gusta esta actividad porque gano mi dinero y le voy enseñando a mis hijos a trabajar porque me ayudan en sus ratos libres". Ella cría los cerdos desde muy pequeños y cuando tienen la edad y el tamaño adecuado los vende y es cuando obtiene sus ganancias las cuales invierte en la compra de mas cerdos y sacar los compromisos de escuela de sus hijos. Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de 2 cerdos y alimentos para continuar realizando su actividad, a Doña Delfina a futuro le gustaría que sus hijos puedan estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
El Esfuerzo is the name of a group made up of 6 women who each work to increase their economic resources and give their family a better quality of life. The group members are: Carolina, who raises pigs; Guadalupe, who sells sodas; Maria del Rosario, who sells sweets; Delfina, who raises pigs; Maria del Carmen, who sells groceries; and Mariana, who sells sodas. This group is located in a community called Guadalupe de Reyes, which is on the edge of the train tracks.

Delfina is a very happy woman who fights for what she wants. She is 30, studied through high school, and is married to Miguel who works as a day laborer. They have 3 children who are in school. She says that 2 years ago she started raising pigs because she wanted to earn a little money and be able to help her husband with the costs of the home. She says "I like this activity because I earn my money and I teach my kids to work since they help me in their free time." She raises the pigs from very small and when they are the right age and size she sells them and earns profits that she invests in the purchase of more pigs, along with paying school fees for her kids. 

She will invest this loan in the purchase of two pigs and their feed to continue doing her work. In the future, Delfina would like for her children to be able to study a profession.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.es:
La señora Ana Laura es originaria de la ciudad de San Luis Potosí, tiene ya mas de diez años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, es madre soltería con un hijo de pequeña edad que esta en preescolar y es su responsabilidad.
La señora Ana Laura tiene un salón de belleza en su propio domicilio. Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir para iniciar otro negocio hay mismo de venta de productos naturales para la salud y así tener mas ingreso para ella y su hijo.
Desea superarse y que su negocio tengan mas ingreso para poder darle a su pequeño la educación para que sea un triunfador.
texts.en:
Ana Laura is a native of the city of San Luis Potosi, but for more than 10 years, she has been living in the city of Nuevo Laredo.  She is a single mother of a young child.  Her child is in pre-school, and is dependent upon her.

Ana Laura has a beauty salon in her home.  She is requesting a loan to invest in another business that she wants to start up, which is selling natural health products.  This way, she could have more income for herself and for her son.

She wants to succeed, and to generate more income through her business so that she can give her little one the education he needs to be successful in life.

loans.use: to start up a line of business selling natural products

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has been a resident of the town of Samburu for several years. She sells fruits and vegetables, which is a profitable business for her. Moreover, her husband, who works as a businessman, is very supportive of her.

With this new funding, she will be able to stock her fruit and vegetable stand. She will buy watermelons, bananas, cabbages, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, kales, etc.

Fatuma has her own source of income, and thanks to her business, she helps in paying for her household expenses.

She is grateful to Yehu for the continued confidence in her.

loans.use: To buy watermelons, bananas, cabbages, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, kales, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a dedicated woman who always struggles to get ahead. She is a visionary woman in her community. Grace has been running a boutique for several years. She says that the previous loan helped enable her to increase the merchandise carried in her store. She was able to include the sale of cosmetics and a tailoring business in addition to the previous line of work. With the current loan, she intends to purchase more cosmetics and buy an overlock sewing machine. She is grateful to Kiva and Yehu for the support she is getting.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is 49 years old business lady in Kilifi. She is a widowed mother of four school-going children. She makes and sells construction bricks, a business she ventured into six years ago.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase chisels and hammers which she uses to shape the bricks with. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. 

She hopes to expand her business and be able to provide employment to the unemployed youths in the community.

loans.use: to purchase chisels and hammers for her brick business

loans.name: Rosas De San Jose 1 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE SAN JOSE 1”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Reveca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: confección de deportivos, venta de mantas, venta de pescados, venta de muebles, venta de ropero, venta de condimentos, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Reveca es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por una promotora de la institución que fue  visitarla a su casa.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de deportivos, da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace años con el apoyo de su esposo y en la actualidad lo trabajan a nivel familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela e hilo) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud.
texts.en:
The lending club "Rosas de San Jose 1" will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focal area of the Andes. The group has 7 members and a board of directors of which Reveca is president. The members of the community association have various businesses including: making athletic gear, selling fish, furniture sales, closet sales, condiment sales and selling cheese.

The loan will benefit the small businesses including member Reveca's. She says that she joined Pro Mujer 5 months ago when one of the institution's promoters when to visit her at home. Currently she has a business making athletic gear. She reveals that she started this business some years ago with the support of her husband and it is now a family business. 

Her loan is to increase her capital (buy fabric and thread) that she will get from the distributors and later manufacture into products that she makes to order. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, since she is married and has a son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the health workshops.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Incondicionales Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INCONDICIONALES”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Janneth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de empanadas, confección y venta de mandiles, venta de comida, venta de relojes y tejido de chompas, venta de coca, compra y venta de muebles y artefactos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Janneth es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de empanadas que aprendió de sus padres hace años atrás, posteriormente ella inicio su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de los carros distribuidores por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará de forma ambulante en la ferias de la cuidad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito porque les ayuda en su vida diaria.
texts.en:
The "Incondicionales" communal bank will begin the first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of one of the institution's regional offices in Santiago. It is comprised of nine members and it's headed by a board of directors presided by Janneth. The members of the communal bank conduct various businesses such as selling empanadas, making and selling aprons, selling food, selling clocks, weaving sweaters, selling coca, buying and selling furniture and utensils.
The loan they received will benefit the small business owners, one of which is Janneth. She reports that it's her first time as a member of Pro Mujer. She joined by invitation from a friend who's a member of the institution and went to visit her at home. She currently owns a business selling empanadas, a trade she learned from her parents years ago and then later on she started her own business.
The loan she will receive now will be used to increase her working capital by purchasing flour. She will buy it from the distributing cars by wholesale. After preparing her products, she'll make traveling sales in the markets of the town of El Alto. This line of work allows her to obtain earnings in order to support her family as much as she can, since she's married and has a son.
When she's asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she enjoys the health and credit trainings, because they help her in her daily life.

loans.use: to purchase flour.

loans.name: Sherwin

texts.en: Sherwin, 36-year old, is a married entrepreneur of Mialen, Clarin and generates earnings from his transport service business. He started this business almost 7 years ago and he earns 8,000 a month. To improve business, Sherwin joined GDMPC Micro Credit in 2010. He has borrowed 17,600 to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires for his motorcycle business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 44 years old, married to Efren and has three children. Her spouse is a farmer who has an unstable income and she has a retail store that she has managed for over 10 years now. She sells grocery items to the people in her village. She usually gains about PHP 300 each day in her business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy grocery items (sardines, eggs, noodles, and soap) to sell in her store. With these additional grocery items, she will increase her sales capacity and profits from the business. 

Lorna would like to keep extending good products and services to her customers so she can earn more profits for the education of her children. She will be very happy and proud to see them as professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like sardines, eggs, noodles, and soap to sell in her store

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es originaria de la ciudad de Tamaulipas es viuda tiene tres hijos dos adolecentes y una menor de edad, desde que falleció su esposo se ha hecho responsables de sus hijos.
La señora Eusebia tiene ya mas de nueve años con su negocio de belleza el cual es una de las fuentes de ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que también cuenta con una pensión que recibe por el fallecimiento de su esposo. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar un vehículo para poder trasportarse de su casa a su negocio y también hacer trabajos de belleza a domicilio de sus clientas.
Desea dar les mejor servicios a sus clientes y así podrá generar más ganancias para su familia. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio será para pagar el crédito ya que con la pensión será para los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eusebia comes from the town of Tamaulipas. She's a widow and has three children - two teenagers and one underage daughter. She has taken over responsibility for her children ever since her husband passed away.
Eusebia has run her beauty parlor business for over nine years already. It's one of the sources of income for her family, since she also receives a pension due to her husband's death.
She's requesting a loan in order to purchase a vehicle so that she can commute from home to work and also provide at-home beauty services to her customers.
She wishes to provide better service to her customers, and that way she'll be able to increase her family's earnings.
She'll repay the loan with the profits she obtains from her business, because the pension is used for her family's expenses and her children's schooling expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle for her business.

loans.name: Jandres

texts.en:
Jandres is a student of the Academy of Maritime Nusantara, taking the Nautical program. This is Jandres story:

From the time I was little, I lived with my grandparents, as my parents died when I was a kid. When my grandfather died, I had to stay with grandma. While Gramma’s earnings are enough for daily needs, grandmother still [needed to] finance my tuition. My grandmother is now 79 years old and ailing and may be forced to stop and close. The stall costs of my grandmother are currently borne by my uncle and, until I finished high school, I was financed by my uncle.

I feel life ever harder. After graduating from high school, I was not able to go to college, because I do not have the fees. Since then, I started working to earn money for college. With this student loan from Kiva, my hopes began to focus again on going to college in order to be successful and make my grandmother and my uncle's family happy. I aspire to become a professional sailor and be successful based on a foundation of misery, hard work and passion.

loans.use: to pay education fees for three years

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, single and lives with his six family members, two of whom are employed.

Abbas owns a bakery. He established his business in 2003 and now he has two employees. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate his bakery. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en: Beverly is 38 years old and married. She is from Capucao, Ozamis City. She has six grown children who have helped her to take care of their coconuts. They have been raising coconuts for five years and earn 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Beverly joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a 32-year-old married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in agricultural produce, mainly maize, and has been in business for five years. He started from farming, where he accumulated capital to buy produce from other farmers. He is faced with the problems of inadequate capital to meet the high demand, price fluctuations and inflation. Benjamin has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house for residence, while his business plan is to trade in a variety of produce such as beans, groundnuts and rice. Benjamin is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal is a hardworking man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. After realizing the lucrative nature of cocoa in the area, he decided to invest in the crop and has since reaped tangible benefits. With the income earned, he has been able to purchase a bicycle and pay school fees for his children. Like most farmers, he has a challenge of high transportation costs and price fluctuation; however, he has a vision of setting up a processing plant so as to add value and sell at a higher price. Micheal intends to use the loan to pay workers who are weeding his cocoa plantation.

loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his cocoa plantation.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Desde que era una niña Julia ha trabajado en las fincas de café. Comenzó al lado de su padre que fue quien le enseñó todo lo necesario para llevar a cabo esta actividad. A la edad de 20 años se casó y tuvo 3 hijas y 2 hijos que actualmente están ya casados, sin embargo para ella fue muy difícil sacarlos adelante pues quedó viuda desde hace 29 años. También tenía a su cargo a un hermano con síndrome de down, sin embargo a base de mucho esfuerzo y con ayuda de sus hijos pudieron salir adelante. Actualmente son sus hijos quienes se encargan de realizar la mayor parte de las labores en las fincas de café y ella se encarga de supervisar los trabajos. Para la siguiente cosecha Julia solicita un crédito para poder pagar a jornaleros que corten el café pues es demasiado trabajo y sus hijos no pueden realizarlo solos. Entre las metas que tiene Julia como productora de café están la de resembrar y comprar más parcelas para poder aumentar su producción.
texts.en: Ever since she was a little girl, Julia has worked on a coffee plantation.  She started with her father whom taught her all the basics to carry out her work.  At the age of 20, Julia wed and had 3 girls and 2 boys who are now married.  It was difficult to raise her children after she widowed nearly 29 years ago and also had to care for her handicapped brother with Down Syndrome, however, she managed to get ahead with a lot of effort and help from her kids.  Her children are currently the ones in charge of carrying out the majority of the work on the coffee fields and Julia is in charge of supervising the work.  Julia hopes to obtain a loan so she can pay temporary workers for the upcoming harvest to cut the coffee, since the workload is too much for her children to do alone.  Amongst her many goals in coffee production, Julia would like to re-plant and purchase more plots of land to increase production.

loans.use: to pay worker's wages

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is now 30 years old and has two young children. She engaged in an early marriage and was not able to finish her education. To generate income for the family, she raises hogs to fatten and breed and then re-sells them for profit. Aside from her hog-raising business, Flordeliza also sells cosmetics and perfumes to her neighborhood as an additional source of income. Though the family is less fortunate, Flordeliza still hopes and works for business improvement. She is now borrowing a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy hog feed, vaccines and medicines for sustainability. This will help ensure good nutrition for the hogs so she can sell them at a higher cost.

Someday, Flordeliza hopes to keep improving her sales from raising hogs and divesify her direct selling business too. Enough funds will help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vaccines, and medicines

loans.name: Gulshan's Group

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 27-year-old hard-working married woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and four daughters. Her husband is a house ceiling maker and one son works with his father. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so for the past six years, Gulshan has been trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She is a tailor and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. Gulshan is a member of a seven-person lending group. She has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education and living in her own house, as she is living currently in a rented house. She is very thankful for KIVA.

Note: In the picture, Gulshan holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing maching for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jazmín Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jazmín se integra de cinco personas un hombre y cuatro mujeres  quienes vive en una montañita y se camina media hora para  llegar a sus domicilio es un lugar muy fresco en donde cosechan el café y plátano.
 
   Quien se le tomo  la entrevista es a la señora Herminia quien  vive en unión libre con el señor Elogio y con quien procreo  creo  tres hijos quienes ya todos están casado, en la no  estudio por falta de ingresos  y pues se quedo con el deso de ir a la escuela.

    Solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como son: azúcar, frijol, aceite, jabón, entre otros para surtir su negocio de abarrotes  en donde lleva seis años y le va muy bien  se cambio  de actividad ya que la otra actividad anterior fue la compra y venta de joyas.
  
  Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad ella pueda seguir trabajando y con el tiempo agrandar más su negocio.

 Las personas que integran el grupo son: Juana quien invertirá el préstamo en la comercialización de ganado, la señora  Consuelito también invertirá en la compra y venta de ganados, la señora Ernestina invertirá en la compra y venta de pollos y don Jorge invertirá en la compra de marranos para engoradar.
texts.en:
The Jazmín group is made up of five members, one gentleman and four ladies, who live on a small mountain where it takes 30 minutes to reach their homes.  It’s a fresh place where coffee and bananas are raised.

Herminia was the one interviewed.  She lives with Elogi and they have three adult children; all are married now.  She did not go to school because her family lacked resources, but she wishes that she could have gone.
 
She requested this loan to invest in merchandise such as sugar, beans, cooking oil, soap, and other things to stock her grocery store.  She has had it for six years and things are going well for her.  She changed her business and the previous one was buying and selling jewelry.
 
What she would really like it to be able to continue working her small business and eventually grow it.
 
The other members of the group are Juanita who will invest the money from this loan in livestock; Consuelito who will also buy livestock; Ermestina who will buy chickens; and Jorge who will buy pigs to fatten up.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Rodelita

texts.en:
This is Rodelita, 52, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a seaman, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while also operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rodelita has a dishwashing liquid. She buys the ingredients and mixes them to make a dishwashing liquid. She then puts them into bottles, retails them and distributes to some variety stores. She also sells them to her neighbors and in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 6,000 in sales weekly. To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy bottles and ingredients of dishwashing liquid. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rodelita hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams to have a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. And it is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy bottles and ingredients needed in her business.

loans.name: Sanyu

texts.en: Sanyu is a 38-year-old hardworking married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He buys produce which helps him to get money for school fees and to look after his family. He has been in his business for 10 years. Sanyu faces the challenges of customers not paying on time, price changes leading to low incomes, and a poor road network. He has future plans of building a permanent house and a business dream of employing other people to help him expand his business. Sanyu intends to use this loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en: Nana is a single parent. She extracts palm oil to sell at Jukwa near Abura. She has been selling palm oil for 10 years now. She has three children and she is responsible for the general upkeep of her children.  Nana will use her loan to purchase palm fruit to enable her to produce more oil for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, she wishes to produce more oil herself

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit to produce more oil to sell

loans.name: Mar De Plata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAR DE PLATA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ruth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, comerciante de prendas de vestir, elaboración de muebles, confección de prendas, venta de linaza y dulces, carnicería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ruth es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa.  En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio ya que su domicilio, lugar donde se ubica este negocio, es estratégico para la venta de productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aceites, azúcar, etc.) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación, crédito y salud.

En la fotografía no esta presente la señora Deysi ya que se encontraba en las consultas médicas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mar de Plata" (Sea of Silver) will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II regional center. It consists of 8 members, and it is governed by a board of directors, where Señora Ruth is the president. The members of the communal bank run a variety of businesses. Among them are neighborhood store, selling clothing, making furniture, making clothing, selling flax seeds and sweets, and butcher shop.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these small microentrepreneurs, such as Señora Ruth. She comments that she has been in Pro Mujer for two loan cycles, joining at the invitation of a loan officer from the institution who went to visit her at home. Now she has a neighborhood store, since her home, where this business is located, is strategically located for selling products.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying oils, sugar, etc., which she will acquire from the wholesale distributors and then will sell in her sales location. This form of work allows her to generate resources to help her family as much as possible, since she is married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training in credit and health.

In the photograph, Señora Deysi is not present because she was in the medical clinic.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, etc., for her store.

loans.name: La Semillita Group

texts.es: Karen tiene 19 años de edad y es originaria una comunidad llamada la venta ella nada mas pudo estudiar hasta el 3° año de preparatoria y dice que dejo de estudiar por falta de recursos ya que son mas hermanos los cuales también estudian la secundaria y la primaria, es por eso que ella emprendió el negocio de la venta de blancos por catalogo, dice que le vende a sus amigas y conocidas que sabe que si pagan ya que vende en pagos. Dice que ahorita ella esta pidiendo un crédito a Visión Fund para comprar colchas, edredones, sabanas, cobijas, cortinas, toallas que tiene como pedidos por parte de sus clientas, también dice que va a venderle a maestras de su comunidad ya que tienen un trabajo estable y le pagan cada quincena, platica que a diario sale a vender sus blancos y que está orgullosa de tener su propio negocio ya que ella espera juntar dinero para pagar el siguiente año la colegiatura ya que quiere estudiar y trabajar.
